title: Beware of unautorised credit card charge.
review: Booked and paid in advance for my booking through Hotels.com. The hotel with out any notification also charged my credit card for the room hire. Despite contacting the hotel the day after my return, there subsequent agreement they should not have made the charge and assurances my card would be credited for the unauthorised charge immediately, it was only some 3 weeks later and with the help of my credit card company that my account was finally credited. Very poor customer service from what purports to be a 5 star hotel.

title: Amazingly close to Alhambra
review: Very nice modern hotel across the street from Alhambra. Our room was very modern and well appointed. However it could have used a couple of shelves or drawers. The sheets and blankets were very nice. They do have an assortment of pillows as ours were like rocks initially. Reception Staff were excellent. Lots of room in the hotel to enjoy sitting rather than being in the room.  The bus was less than a block.we were not in Sevilla long enough to spend much time in the old section so I’m not sure if the location would have bothered us.

title: Wonderful location & beautiful
review: A wonderful location for touring the Alhambra and beautiful hotel (very nice pool and patio), the service is slow, the restaurant lacking in cuisine and guest attention. Average to poor hotel value, many other places to stay in Granada.

title: Great location and property
review: The staff was particularly charming and accommodating as the bar was closed at the pool and they were happy to make sure we got cocktails! The room is well appointed and the location is fantastic. The only comment would be that the pool furniture could be refreshed as the chaises were in distress, but otherwise, it was super!

title: It's All About The Location
review: Okay. Disclosure. We booked this hotel first because of its location.  We did not want to climb up a steep hill or get crammed in a bus to see the Alhambra.  Lazy, absolutely! This hotel was perfect for us.  We booked a Double room and it was very comfortable, clean and a good size.  Plenty of closet space and room for our luggage.  Loved the bathroom!  Very modern. Had a choice between using the tub in one room or the shower in the other room.  Yes, there were two separate rooms.  The shower head was amazing.  Could have stood there all day after a long day of travelling. The air-conditioning worked well, no issues which was important because it was SO HOT outside!  We booked directly with the hotel website and we received a free breakfast and two bottles of water (which we used at Alhambra).  Breakfast was very nice.  Plenty of choices at the buffet.  There is also a menu at the tables which indicates different styles of eggs you can order- no extra charge.  Had dinner at the hotel. The pizza, burger and salmon were very good.  Staff were very nice and accommodating.  They spoke English well.  They provided maps and recommendations on what to do in Granada.    If you are like us and just went to Granada for a quick stop to see the Alhambra (and lazy), then this is the place to stay.  Great hotel and it's all about the location.…

title: Excellent stay
review: Had a very good stay at this hotel. Location is next to the Alhambra. Very clean and modern room. Courteous staff. Good breakfast. Walking distance to a few restaurants. Area location was green, very clean. Will stay here again when in Granada.

title: Right Next to the Alhambra
review: The Eurostars Washington Irving has pluses and minuses. The most positive thing is that it is a 4 minute walk to the entrance do the iconic Alhambra. The downside is you are way up a hill with lots os steep steps tp take you into the center of town. There are buses and of course taxis to help you. The rating is 5 Stars which is iffy at best. 4 Stars would be more accurate. Most rooms are rather small as well. A swimming pool is a plus.

title: Great location for the Alhambra.
review: nice hotel near to the Alhambra.  Hot when we were there so great to have pool on the roof and good aircon in the rooms.  Rooms are good and the food is good as well.  Easy to walk into the centre of Granada.

title: Service is Lacking for a "5 Star" Hotel
review: After the initial check-in, we really didn't have great service at this hotel. No one offered to help with our bags or showed us to our room (typical in a 5 star hotel). I felt like I was bothering the staff when I asked how the coffee machine worked at breakfast or when ordering a glass of wine at the bar. The bar at the pool was closed early and there was no way to ask about it except for going down to the front desk. Also, no washcloths or tissues in the room and an odd layout for the bathroom. The location can't be beat and it was clean, but still not 5 star.

title: Good location adequate hotel.
review: Front desk staff very helpful. Room was a typical modern basic and comfortable bed.  Art work was beautiful. Breakfast quite good.   Great lunch on terrace which is lovely. Near the Alhambra. Pool was small unheated. Good for cool off followed by sauna. Netflix available on tv.   Housekeeping staff seemed slim and room service not great. Said it would be an hour later in the day. Phone did not work. We ended up with Mini bar dinner.    Nice but needs a bit of work.

title: Incredible Hotel!
review: It gets 3 stars because it was under staffed. The front desk guys checked you in carried bags served as concierge and got the bags to your room. They were very busy and took some time for them to get the bags up and make dinner reservations. Other than that hotel is wonderful. Far away from city center 30 min walk but next door to Alhambra so depending on what your plan is its either comvinient or not.

title: Nice but not really a five star hotel
review: This is a well situated hotel for visits to the Alhambra being right across the street from the entrance. Also the train that does a tour of the city stops right opposite too - handy. It is at the top of a very steep hill through a forest into town so not for the infirm or those not used to uphill climbing. We arrived early and they kindly parked our car and we were told our room was ready. The room itself was fine, but just little things let it down. Firstly the operation of the light switches was strange. Couldn’t get the lights to turn off or on properly. No hooks to hang towels or bathrobes, no tissues in the room -  a used glass left in the room for two consecutive days, no turndown service - all things that a five star should have. The staff were very nice and helpful -…

title: Granada weekend break
review: Excellent hotel, we had breakfast included and there was good choice.  The staff were pleasant and helpful.  They had many recommendations for what to do in Granada.  The valet parking was very handy when we arrived.

title: Very good location and great hotel
review: The hotel is 2 minutes away from the entrance to the Alhamba and also walking distance from the other attractions and many restaurants. The rooms are very nice and modern and breakfast was good.  The staff was nice and helpful.

title: Ideally located for Alhambra Palace
review: Step out of the hotel and across the road is the main entrance into the medina of the Alhambra & Nasrid Palaces and amazing gardens. The facilities are excellent with a roof top pool & bar to relax after exploring the palaces and the staff are all very friendly and have good english language if Spanish is a problem. Breakfast is fresh, varied and fully stocked every morning. Finishing touches include robes and slippers in your room which are all modern and exceptionally clean.

title: Great choice for visiting Alhambra
review: Located right next to the magnificent Alhambra, the hotel allows us to take the night tour of the palace and go back the very beginning of the next day to explore the full glory of Alhambra and Generalife.  It will take a bit walk to the town centre, back and forth.  Well, I would say it is actually a benefit after a full meal in the old town.    The room is spacious, clean and well equipped.  Plus the courteous staff are always attentive and helpful.  Definitely a top choice when visiting Granada.

title: Very Poor Service
review: The Pros:  Brilliantly located for the Alhambra.  Stylish decor - a modern take on the Alhambra Moorish theme.  The Cons:  On multiple occasions the service from staff across the hotel was poor and disinterested.  We had a problem with a power cut in our room while getting ready, which we were told would be sorted while we were out at dinner. We returned at midnight to find still no power in our room and be informed by reception when asked that we would have to move rooms at this point. We were offered no assistance while we scrambled to find a few belongings in a pitch black room and locate a new room.  The next day we were told the power would be sorted but we again returned from our day touring to find this had not occurred and were told we would need to change rooms again.…

title: Fabulous Stay
review: The staff is really profesional and helpfull. We really enjoyed our stay. Lovely room, clean and big. Excellent breakfast and food are really nice. Fantastic Experience we had. We will be back for sure.

title: Best place to stay
review: We stayed in this hotel and decided to stay another night ... it’s right next to the Alhambra... but more than that ... the rooms are stylish ... clean ... the house keepers should be commended .. I returned to the room to get something and the housekeeper had pulled the bed away .  The pool was lovely and the team serving food at the pool area were fantastic ... perfect Ambassador ‘s for a business ... What can I say ... we live in the Uk and Spain but when not if .. we return to Granada we will be staying here . Thank you to all the team for a pleasant stay .

title: Excellent hotel with a fantastic location opposite the Alhambra
review: We stayed in the Andalusia suite, beautiful room. We really enjoyed our stay for 3 nights. During our stay the staff provided us every day with nice treats to make our stay even more special. We really appreciated that! Nice swimming pool which gives you the possibility to chill out after a day visiting the city of Granada.

title: Exceleent hotel on a excellent location
review: Excellent location, near the Alahambra ( 2 min walk)  and an exceelent hotel, beuatful modern hotel, friendly staff, spacious rooms. We enjoyd our stay very much. Staff speaks english very well.  Rooms and bathrooms are very clean.

title: Quality and Style
review: I am a frequent 5* traveller and I really liked this cosy hotel. Staff is friendly, rooms are beautifully decorated with quality materials and bfast is very good. The pool on top of the roof is really nice and when I come back I will surely stay in this hotel again.

title: Excellent
review: Modern 5 star hotel within walking distance of Alhambra Palace. Only three years old so everything is new and in good condition. Rooms are comfortable and spacious and bathrooms are well appointed. No onsite parking but valet parking available at 20 Euros a day. Reception staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. Great value for a hotel of this standard at 95 Euros for the night although breakfast is expensive at 16 Euros. Rooftop swimming pool is a bonus.

title: Lovely but there were shortcomings.
review: It was a lovely hotel but our room was not really made for three people.  The room was a little tight. The pool was rather small and when filled with children-- it was not conducive for a relaxing time.

title: Al that at Al Hambra.
review: We visited Granada for one night stay with the main goal to see Al Hambra. The hotel is perfect situated regarding that and if you want A short and nice stroll to the center and Plaza Nueva. We stayed in room 308 and 309 with 3 kids and 2 adults. Great accomodation and with windows towards the Al Hambra. The hotel has also a nice pool and great breakfast and serviceminded personell. If we visit Granada again we would surly go back👍🏻

title: Across the street from the Alhambra
review: The hotel is very nice and not at all expensive compared to other similar places. Location, you are right across the Alhambra which means on top of the hill so if you like to go into town you have to come up, which is a 10-15 min walk depending how fit you are. We enjoyed it after a dinner meal. Te staff is very friendly and the Hotel itself a very nice Boutique style hotel with a small pool and an even smaller gymn. If in Granada I would stay there again.

title: Fantastic property, but...
review: The property is lovely with a nicely decorated lobby/ bar with restaurant terrace and a small rooftop gym and pool.   The location was ALMOST perfect. It’s right across the street from the Alhambra grounds. I say almost perfect because there aren’t many restaurant options nearby and they are both uphill. However, it is only a 15 minute walk  downhill to the city center where you’ll find shops and other food options. If you find the hills too steep, the hotel  is very close to the city bus stop.   The buffet breakfast has a good variety of healthy and hearty selections - including pancakes. I thought it was a good value.  The staff was wonderful - very friendly and extremely helpful. They even provided a “brown-bag” breakfast our last morning because we had an early train.  The…

title: great location, helpful staff... but not a five-star hotel
review: We were looking for a 5-star hotel in granada and chose this hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor.  Pros:  • great location (right across from the Alhambra) • very friendly and helpful staff Cons: • this simply does not have the amenities of a 5-star hotel.     • There are only 2 front-desk staff, 1 of whom is the porter who has to move all the luggage from the cars to the     rooms. Of note, we were aware that there is no parking on premises but there is a valet service, which was fine.    • The air-conditioning is not up to par (reading some other reviews here confirms this). This is the only hotel in which the thermostat will not actually tell you the temperature in your room! to do that you have to call downstairs and have them check it on the computer. When we arrived the…

title: Beware: not the service expected of 5* hotel
review: BEWARE! Booked on their website direct to try and support the hotel. Made an error (my own, clicked wrong button) with dates and contacted hotel within 48hrs.  The daily room rates for the new dates were more expensive and I offered to pay difference and extra for a more expensive room!! Told no changes could be made due to non-refundable rate. Terrible service for a 5 star hotel. WILL NOT BOOK OR STAY AGAIN

title: 5 Star Hotel - not really
review: Positives: Great location just steps from the Alhambra, capable and friendly staff, a guitarist at breakfast - a charming touch.  Negatives:  Cramped and poorly laid out bathroom (beware the awkward doors - we had a thumb badly bruised), not enough towels in the room, breakfast selection and quality not up to par, no AC in the hall ways, crowded pool area.  Overall: An ok hotel, but just doesn’t measure up to other five star properties

title: Dissapointment
review: We had lots of expectations with this hotel. The pool service was very poor with only 1 attended and poor food. The location was fantastic but the lack of a car park only made us lost a lot time. The personnel was very helpful but the loading and unloading of bags were too much of a hassel for a 5 star hotel.

title: Loved It
review: Just got back from this hotel and we had a fabulous time. The room and staff were both excellent. Breakfast was also lovely and set us up for a day being a tourist, very well. Would happily recommend.

title: Fantastic location, great rooms!
review: Eurostar Washington Irving offers a fantastic location right next to the Alhambra entrance (2 minute walk), and you can see it from the entrance. Rooms are well appointed and comfortable, modern great taste with hints of local decorative styles. Highly recommend this place. Staff are friendly, and knowledgeable.

title: Great Hotel
review: Nice, elegant, comfortable and perfect location!  Nice decor, just renovated! Big rooms and bathrooms.  Delicious buffet breakfast and good quality restaurant!  Very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly staff! The Alhambra just in front!!!

title: Excellent
review: It is a hotel with excellent service and location. Everything in the hotel is furnished so that one can relax and do nothing. A big plus is the sea salt pool. This hotel has 5 stars. I was very satisfied. And I'll be back.

title: Very nice hotel and location, rooms a bit dark
review: Eurostars Washington Irving enjoys a privileged location at the footsteps of the Alhambra, making it very convenient for guests to tour this historic site. The decor is modern and the service is businesslike. The bed quality and bathroom/shower was of good quality. The motion sensor lights in the closet kept turning on and off which was a bit annoying. The wood panelling in the rooms with yellow lighting made the rooms somewhat dark but this is a small issue. I would rate the hotel 4-4.5 stars instead of 5. Very competent hotel. Overall grade A-

title: Beautiful Property
review: I was amazed with the service of each one at the front office. Every person were very friendly and very co-operative.  The rooms were very nice and all the amenities were excellent.  The food is excellent.  Highly recommended.

title: Clean and Efficient with no Soul
review: We were very happy with this hotel in every way. It is right next to Alhambra and a pleasant walk away from the town. The rooms are new and clean. Breakfast was nice as well.   My only issue with the hotel is that it feels like a business hotel in Dusseldorf. No feeling of the surroundings whatsoever. So if it is the Andalucian experience you are looking for you will not get it. Other than that you will find a good hotel with good service which was more than enough for us.

title: Perfect location - friendly staff - quality hotel
review: We spent two nights there in June 2019. It had the feel of an international 5 star hotel throughout. Room was spacious and bathroom was high spec with brilliant shower. Hotel is located almost on the grounds of the Alhambra Palace. Hard to get any closer. I had one problem with the valet parking   But Angela the manager called me later and personally apologised and cancelled all my parking charges.   You can walk to the centre of town in 10 minutes all downhill and get a taxi back for €5.   Staff were professional and helpful.   We didn’t get time to use the pool, gym or sauna but they looked well appointed and clean   I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

title: Granada and the Eurostar
review: The Washington Irving is a good place to stay at. Modern, spacious and very well located to La Alhambra and to downtown Granada (through a beautiful garden forest).  Breakfast is great. The vallet parking  service is mandatory if you go driving.  The hotel staff was always ready to recommend what to visit and where to eat.

title: Lovely
review: A very happy two nights in March with a luxurious bedroom overlooking the Alhambra.  The hotel is definitely worthy of its five stars, very stylish and really comfortable - room and bathroom were amazing.  Hotel staff were helpful and friendly, providing directions and great food recommendations for the town.  Bar staff were chatty, explaining the craft beer options.  Breakfast was really good, fresh and delicious.    We parked in the Alhambra car park and left it for two days.  It's walkable to the city centre from the hotel; Granada is busy and not a great city to drive in as roads in the centre are way narrow.  Top class!

title: Glad we stayed there
review: We debated whether to stay here or in the city centre, and felt we had made the right decision. The hotel is opposite the Alhambra, but is equally convenient for trips intot he centre. Easier to walk downhill into the centre thanto go back up the hill, but only a short taxi ride if you are feeling tired. Not sure about its 5 stars, more of a solid 4 star in my opinion, but still very good. A good bar lunch. aND VERY PLEASANT AND HELPFUL STAFF, ESPECIALLY cRISTINA WHO HELPED US SORT OUT A MINOR PROBLEM THAT WAS ENTIRELY OF OUR MAKING AND NOTHING OT DO WITHTHE HOTEL BUT WHO HELPED US WITHOUT HESITATION. wE WOULD STAY THERE AGAIN.

title: Close to the Alhambra
review: Granada is a hilly city so may not be ideal for guests who cannot walk unless you have made arrangements for the hills. Took a tour of the city unfortunately could not get tickets for the Alhambra. My husband had a fall so we were restricted to what we could do however it would be a paradise for jogger and hikers..there are a lot of interesting places to eat we however stayed for one night and ate at the hotel. Rooms are very comfortable the breakfast was very good a lot of variety. bought chocolates at Sabor Espano

title: Perfect hotel
review: We had 3 rooms overlooking the Alhambra for a 4 night break with family.  Rooms were spotless and very modern.  Large bathrooms with bath and shower. Breakfast was fantastic; lots of choice and Nespresso coffee. One evening, we ate in the bar, which was very nice.  Drinks reasonably priced. This was our second time to Granada, it is a relaxing city, and is worth going to just to see the Alhambra.

title: Great service & great location!
review: This is an excellent location for visiting the Alhambra.  Service is excellent!  Highly recommend staying here.  Hotel offers valet parking off-site, has a small rooftop pool and has nicely appointed rooms.  The Alhambra is less than a two minute walk from the hotel on a quiet tree lined street.

title: Perfect Hotel to visit the Alhambra
review: It is the perfect Hotel to visit the Alhambra. Very friendly staff, excellent room and parking services, nice recommendations for restaurants in the old town. We liked the hotel a lot and enjoyed the time.

title: Great location, great facilities
review: Our stay at Washington Irving was great. On arrival check in was easy and our hire car whisked away and valet parked for us. The room was spacious and well appointed. Decor is modern and quite minimalist. The room was spotlessly clean. The bathroom had separate bath and walk in shower and   lovely toiletries. We enjoyed late afternoons at the pool with cocktails - a great way to spend a couple of hours after sight-seeing. The walk into the centre takes about 10 minutes and is down hill through gardens next to Alhambra. We also walked back each time as although it's uphill it was a pleasant walk. Breakfast was great with loads to choose from on the buffet which served hot and cold choices. All in all a great hotel with friendly service in a great location.

title: Best Location for the Alhambra
review: Wanted something close to the Alhambra and parking so we didn't have to drive in Granada. After a rustic hotel in Ronda, we decided we wanted something different. The Washington Irving is beautiful, walking distance to the Alhambra and the center of town.  We enjoyed the beautiful room, awesome shower, secluded patio and the ambiance of The Who,emplace. The staff spoke English, were very helpful and such a pleasure to work with. Wait staff at breakfast and for late night cocktails were professional, courteous and fun.  Breakfast is a vast array of items with superb coffee, tea and fruits, meats, cheeses, eggs to order and beyond. Best breakfast by far.  This location is really nice.  Parking is nearby, it's a walk to the Alhambra and a bot longer for sunsets up the hill.  We…

title: Comfortable and convenient hotel
review: Location is perfect for visiting the Alhambra-- less than 10 minutes walk to the entrance.  It's an easy walk down hill in to the main part of town.  We took Ubers back to the hotel (it's a steep walk up hill)  The hotel has as excellent bar and restaurant with friendly staff.    Our room was nicely designed and clean.  Excellent air conditioning and shower.

title: Fabulous Hotel
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Washington Irving hotel. The room was excellent with views over the Alhambra and the staff were very helpful. Breakfast was always good but walked to the town in the evenings so never tried dinner.

title: Echo all the 5 star reviews
review: It's hard to think of anything that's not perfect here. The service and staff couldn't be better; your whim is their command. Ok, it's modern, nestled just below the Alhambra entrance, but being modern is refreshing after so much glorious architecture and history. Give yourself a treat and stay here. It's our second visit and I hope not the last.

title: Beautiful  fully restored hotel
review: Located directly opposite the Alhambra Palace and walkable into city centre- downhill. Get a taxi or minibus back ! Hotel is understated luxury. Very comfortable. Very stylish. Staff are very customer focussed. Lovely pool area. As a tribute to Washington Irvine- there is a small library/collection of his books. Chargeable valet parking available if arriving by car.

title: Carolyn O’Gara
review: Excellent hotel.  Staff so helpful & friendly.  Rooms - soooo clean and all you need.  Breakfast - excellent.  Tip - book a room with breakfast & parking included - well worth the tiny extra.  Great pool area.

title: Excellent and we haven’t even left yet!
review: I just know the rest of our three day stay will be good. Luxurious room, spotlessly clean, very helpful reception staff and barman. Quite unlike our previous Eurostar at Mijhas golf, where we had no hot water for two days!  But according to them everything was ok as they said we could move rooms on the third day! Unfortunately we are leaving this brilliant hotel and going back for one night to Mijas. I wish we could stay here instead.

title: Amazing hotel and 3-4 minute walk to Alhambra.
review: Great hotel and every detail of the room is designed for perfection. All lights are either backlit or recessed. Service was amazing. There is a cool little library of Washington Irving's earliest books.  There is a pillow menu! What is that!?!?

title: Great location so close to Alhambra
review: My husband and I stayed here from 7/26-7/29/2018.  Breakfast was included.  Cost was 551€/$603.82 for the 3 nights in the cheapest room which was a double/twin.  The per day charge was different depending on the day of the week.  We stayed Thursday, Friday, and Saturday.  Thursday was the cheapest rate and Saturday was the most expensive rate.  We had a rental car so parking for that was an additional  54.0€/$62.99 for the 3 days.        We were driving from Cordoba.  No GPS in the car.  We had no trouble finding Alhambra but all we saw was a parking lot.  Couldn't seem to find the street for our hotel.  No signs.  Eventually we were directed by a guy walking near the parking lot we first saw.  The street that we thought was for the parking lot is actually the street where our…

title: Perfect place!!!
review: First time in an Eurostar!! Always stayed in an American brand but we try this hotel because the location. A true 5 star hotel! Everything works as expected! Comfy beds, very spacious room for european standard. They charge about 18 euros for breakfast buffet but you can have fresh fruit and order custom eggs. We didn't have a formal dinner at the restaurant, instead have some drinks ,pizza and pasta at the bar. Great food!. Location is just in front of the Alhambra in a hill. You can comfortable walk down to the town about 20 minutes or take the bus that stop a few feet from the hotel. The personal is very courteous and willing to help you. I definetely recommend this hotel and stay again when back to Granada.

title: Hot
review: Room way too hot despite repeated requests to have it turned down it would always revert to scorching.  Handy for the Alhambra but  nothing else. Bar is soulless and breakfast a bit hit and miss, not enough staff, one poor man doing everything. Pool area a little shabby, uneven paving, dirty pool. Woman hosing down the pool area carried on and sprayed us with water while we were on the sun beds. Poor lighting throughout

title: Almost 5 star
review: Given 5 stars by the city of Granada criteria but 4 stars for the hotel and 5 stars for the kitchen and service. Reception outstanding and very helpful about tourist sites. Rooms great but, as noted by others, nowhere to hang towels and robes and no complimentary water. The hotel is perfect for access to the Alhambra but at the top of a hill which may be daunting for some but ideal for us after a big lunch! We had a wonderful dinner at the hotel with amazing service from our waiter Moses. The food was 2-3 star Michelin.

title: The best hotel to visit La Alhambra
review: A couple of weeks ago, we stayed at this hotel and rented two rooms. One with a King and a second with 3 beds (it was actually two beds and the opened sofa bed).  If you are going to visit La Alhambra, you MUST stay here. It's right across the main entrance and in the middle of the Alhambra environment.  It's 15 - 20 minutes walking from downtown, so if you want to be in the city environment, the hotel is not for you.  Very peacefull and quite environment. Don't come here if you want to party, because it's not the place.  The Front Desk staff is very corteous and accomodating.

title: Well presented but lacking for a 5 star
review: The property looks nice and so do the rooms, although there is a distinctive lack of character. It looks like a stylish business hotel.  The rain shower in the rooms is fantastic and the breakfast buffet was of high quality. Sadly the staff at breakfast were not the most enthusiastic.  Unfortunately there are several points that lead me to leaving a 3 star review.  We were celebrating a significant birthday. I emailed them in advance and they promised a surprise to recognise the birthday, but they didn’t do anything. Not even a birthday card.  On arrival by taxi under the rain with 4 suitcases, no one offered to help. A 5 star hotel without a porter is something I’d never heard of before.  No water in the room apart from two small bottles on arrival.  No turndown service.  One…

title: Warm and welcoming
review: Hotel is lovely, staff went far above to make us feel welcome!  The location is perfect for touring the Alhambra or walking in to Granada.  Gorgeous gardens and paths.  Ask for a room with a garden view.

title: A real 5 Star hotel
review: The location, facility and staff of this hotel are the absolute best.  We had a beautiful view of the La Alhambra. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  Although not inexpensive, it is a very good value.

title: Good option if you are just visiting the Alhambra
review: The hotel is immediately opposite the entrance to the Alhambra so very convenient for that.  It is about a 20 min walk downhill to the town and a bit of a slog back for the able-bodied and potentially very difficult for anyone else.  Not much else near the hotel - there is a bar-restaurant next door and the Alhambra Palace hotel a few minutes away, which has an outside terrace bar with an amazing view.  Well worth a visit and a drink, which was also excellent.  Nothing at Eurostar that you would make you want to have dinner or a drink in the dark, nondescript bar.  The buffet breakfast was excellent.

title: So close to the Alhambra!
review: Such a great hotel in the best location for the Alhambra. We even walked to and from the city, but be prepared for hills. Excellent staff, so polite and helpful.  Good size room and a lovely bathroom! Will definitely recommend to friends and will choose the chain for other locations.

title: Quiet and convenient for visit to The Alhambra
review: Beautiful hotel in easy walking distance to The Alhambra across the road and down the hill to the town center. Staff was really helpful in retrieving and sending something I left in the room. Great breakfast included. Bar is nice place to relax and have a salad or sandwich.

title: Granada at its best
review: The best hotel to start our road trip of Andalcia!  Hired a car from Granada  Pre booked car parking arrived at the hotel to be greeted by valet parking which was fabulous as the hotel is in the grounds of the Alhambra. Perfect position hotel and staff can not do more for you. Room was perfect, very modern, beautiful bathroom with separate bath and shower.  French balcony overlooking the Alhambra. Beautiful view day and night . Breakfast was fantastic couldn’t have wanted for anything. Hotel recommended Restaraunt for the evening in the old Town together with great tapas in the day. Would highly recommend this hotel you won’t be disappointed.

title: Super location and service!
review: Stayed for 1 night and wish we could have stayed longer.  The hotel is located very close to the Alhambra and a quick 10 minute walk into the town area.  Rooms are very modern and bathrooms are up to date.  Breakfast was included and it was great.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.  I would stay here again.

title: Great experience !
review: We visited Granada to submerged ourselves in Alhambra for a couple of days. If that’s your plan, this is the hotel for you. All you have to do is open your window and you will see the Alhambra walls, listen to birds and breath the Fresh air. Quiet lovely!!!  The hotel is modern, well kept/maintained and well managed as far as I could tell. Staff are very friendly, informative and helpful.  Rooms are spacious, modern and comfortable but if you can go for a suite.  The views and the fresh air you get when you open all the windows is very very nice.  I recommend talking walks during the evening. You just have to step outside and trust me, you won’t regret it.

title: Overall good
review: This hotel is in a great position minutes from the main entrance to the Alhambra and a short walk through a beautiful park down into town. Overall it was a great hotel,the reception staff were very good especially the young man who arranged our flamenco evening and collected our car. The bed was very comfortable and the room spacious. A few niggles The cleaning of the room was just about ok there were some suspect hairs on the floor !!! The towels were thin I would expect better if it’s a five star hotel The breakfast was poor with hot food running out and it appeared understaffed The lighting in the room was overly complicated That said we had a comfortable stay and the location makes up for it all.

title: Superb Hotel by the Alhambra Palace
review: Recently stayed at the Eurostars Washington Irving based on a recommendation from a neighbour. Didn't disappoint. The location is next to the Alhambra Palace which is the number one tourist location in Granada. The centre of the city is a 15 minute walk down hill although a little longer when coming back. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and we had a view of the Palace from our balcony. The breakfast buffet had a good selection. Would stay at this hotel again. Recommended.

title: Great location and services
review: So close to The Alhambra for easy access.  Great services at reception and breakfast venue.  Highly recommend.  Easy connection to town by bus, walking, taxi, and could enjoy the quiet evening.  Room is clean and well equip for all we need.

title: In love with Granada
review: The Hotel it have a perfect location, in front of The Alhambra! Surrounded by nature and history. Walking distance(by a beautiful park) you can get to the Albaicin, Paseos de los Tristes and the shopping area. Rooms are very clean and spacious, very quiet area comparing with other hotels in Granada. Is you need parking they have Valet service for 18e per night.

title: A chic design hotel very close to Alhambra at the uphill
review: The reason to choose this hotel is because it is just 4 minutes walk from Alhambra.  And some of rooms can see the Alhambra very closely.  Our stay is in winter time, so the surroundings is quiet and peace.  Every morning and evening we walked 10-15 mins to the downtown via a beautiful garden (we believe it belongs a part of Alhambra)  right next to the hotel, it’s just a straight ramp, very enjoyable if you like walking and don’t kind to get yourself few exercise.  Otherwise you can take mini bus right C30 or C32 right next to the hotel.  The hotel is neat and clean, I was informed that it is just 2 years old, so everything in the room is quite new and in very good condition.  A tiny but beautiful balcony   Staff is very helpful and responsive in all aspects, our special thanks…

title: Nice hotel next to Alhambra
review: Nice modern facilities, well maintained. Very white location. Walking distance tó Alhambra. City centre is by taxi for 5 Eurós in 10 minutes. Taxis are widely available. Excellent breakfast but a bit expensive. Very pleasent and helpful pesonnel. English is well spoken.

title: Great staff and location
review: The staff are wonderful, you get sense that they would accommodate any request.  Also the location for the Alhambra is perfect.  There are a couple of negatives though.  If you get a room facing the road you will get some noise from the cars going over the cobblestones.  The other negative is the hotel seems a bit flimsy, for example when my neighbours slammed their door my bed would actually shake and the screen behind the bed would rattle.  Despite these two things I would definitely stay again if I return to Granada.

title: Mixed Review - pre-book the Alhambra !
review: It's a 5 star hotel right opposite the Alhambra castle. We arrived to find there is no parking and told the valet will park your car some 3km from the hotel. Also were informed that you have to pre-book online access to the Alhambra which we had no idea so that option was taken away immediately. Walked into the town of Granada down the hill from the hotel some 10 mins and found the area really disappointing, somewhat dirty crowded tapas bars and really no good food option. We had dinner in the hotel , ordered a well done steak that had to be sent back twice as first time came out raw, this is something that really bugs me in restaurants of a 5 star hotel. The restaurant could do with some music , it had no atmosphere and the bar area is pretty dark and gloomy, only one member of…

title: Visiting the Alhambra
review: The hotel location is extremely close to the Alhambra and within walking distance of number of bars and cafes. Be aware that the hotel location is high up and so the traveller needs to be reasonably fit to access the shops at the bottom of the hill by the steps. The staff were really helpful and the room really good value for money and peaceful. Breakfasts were served in a small restaurant being a mix of table service and a buffet with a good selection. We eat out at night so can't comment on the evening meal quality.

title: Highly recommended
review: An excellent modern hotel with friendly and attentive staff. The rooms are spotless, spacious, comfortable and stylish. Breakfast offered everything. A genuine 5 star option for any visit to fabulous Granada.

title: Pleasant Stay
review: Excellent attention by the Staff. Room very comfortable and very nicely decorated. Expectations from such a 5 Star hotel fullfilled.Excellent breakfast, too. Surrounded by the beautiful Gardens El Generalife the hotel is in a quite place, in a relaxed atmosphere far from the crowded main streets which was what we were looking for.It's a nice 15 minutes Walk to the centre.

title: Excellent
review: It is really difficult to say what could be found wrong with this hotel. Location is excellent, good price for value, staff is excellent. Receptionists are really helpful. Separately I would like to say thank you to receptionist Kristina for your help.

title: Great Stay
review: The hotel is large, spacious, and modern. The service was flawless, hospitable, and fast. The hotel is right across from the Alhambra, making it a great location to access the complex before the crowds come pouring in. They have valet parking for about 17 euros a day. It is a quick taxi ride down the hill to the city center or if you are up for a jaunt about 10 minutes down the hill. I recommend staying here for a morning visit to the Alhambra.

title: Alhambra visit
review: Very good location rooms are brilliant along with the facilities staff very helpful I would stay at this hotel again close to the bus stops and easy access to the walkways into town very clean well presented hotel overall.GK

title: First hotel I  have stayed at with a “ pillow menu”......
review: Yes you can even choose which pillow you would prefer. I rang down to reception to change mine, and 3 minutes later there was a knock on the door and hey presto - two feather pillows. This really is a nice hotel to stay in, clean, modern and roomy. Go up to the top floor and checkout the fitness room and sauna, and outdoor pool - immaculate, although I did not avail myself of the facilities. The breakfasts are lovely, you can go and help yourself to the usual fare, of which there is plenty, or order your eggs poached, scrambled with ham or cheese, boiled or fried. Coffee from capsule machine, good selection of teas and fruit juices and the selection of cakes and pastries has my mouth watering, even now. Bedroom very nice, with a small balcony overlooking the wall of the…

title: Fantastic hotel in a great location
review: Stayed here for one night as family of 4 in two rooms (2 adults and 2 kids) and honestly cannot and do not want to find any faults.   The rooms are spacious, the location is superb (1 min from entrance to Alhambra and a 5 Euro taxi to the centre of Granada).   We spent 2 hours in the bar which was lovely and cosy.   All the staff at the front desk and the bar were really pleasant, knowledgeable and friendly.   We are returning in April 2019.

title: FANTASTIC
review: We had a wonderful stay at the Eurostar Washington Irving. The hotel it’s self is beautifully decorated, and the rooms are excellently appointed. The hotel has a very peaceful ambience with the various water features and roof top pool.  The hotel is set in amazing surroundings, in close proximity to both the Alhambra as well as the town.  The staff are as you would expect of a 5 star hotel and you would be hard pushed to find a better alternative in Granada.

title: Fantastic Alhambra Location
review: Beautifully fitted out inside with lovely well planned rooms. everywhere spotlessly clean. Reception very helpful. The rooftop pool would be lovely in the warmer months. The Alhambra is minutes away so the location is excellent. The centre of town is 10 minutes walk down hill with various routes all of which are different and lovely walks. The little red busses cost 1.40 euro's per trip and its possible to go to all places of interest on these buses from outside the hotel - great to avoid walking back up the hill!!

title: Beautiful Spanish hotel in a forested park just outside the walls of the Alhambra
review: We were in Granada in November when the city is alive with autumn magic.  Washington Irving is really a 5 star hotel with very low prices.  I don't know how they manage because everything (rooms, dining room, hotel style and amazing location) is very first class. The rooms and the entire hotel seem new with a contemporary Spanish style.  The location is in the vast forested park that surrounds the Alhambra.  When you walk out the door into the park you're only about 100 yards from the Alhambra entrance (couldn't be better)  It's a beautiful downhill walk of about 15 minutes through the park to the best Granada neighborhoods.  You can walk back up the hill or take a cab for 4 or 5 euros. A very restful and romantic place to stay in the enchanted city of Granada. Note on the…

title: Great service
review: The hotel staff has been really great and with their friendliness and helpfulness has made up for much of my travel disaster (hotel-unrelated flight issues...). I'd go there again!Especially in summer, this hotel is wonderful. And its proximity to Alhambra is another plus!

title: Great hotel a few steps away from the Alhambra
review: I stayed one night at the Eurostars Washington Irving with my wife (November 2018).It was our first time in Granada.The hotel was surprisingly nice and welcoming.Great welcome from the front desk team. The rooms are spotless, large and well equipped. Our room (#303) was overlooking the Alhambra walls: wonderful at sunrise!Breakfast is succulent. All in all a great, modern and well managed property in which you feel good.

title: Excellent hotel and brilliant location!!!
review: Great stay and extremely pleasant and courteous staff! Full points.  The rooms are really nice,toilets are a bit small but pretty manageable. Tea coffee facilities in the room are good. The outside patio is lovely and great to just unwind and chill. The food to is great. We had lunch and a breakfast, both were super. Great sangria's!!!  The location is superb and just 2 min to the Alambhra so it was really convenient as we could just come back and and then go back again.

title: Great hotel, great location
review: The main attraction of the Washington Irving is of course its location. The hotel directly faces the Alhambra with both the main and secondary entrances less than 5 minutes walk from the lobby but is also a very reasonable 10-15mins  walk to Plaza Nueva (centre of Granada) down a lovely tree lined path. For reasons of location alone I would wholly recommend the Washington Irving. The hotel itself is modern and stylish and we found our room very comfortable with lots of space and a really nice rainfall shower in the bathroom. An added bonus was the fruit plates that the hotel staff kindly brought to our room every afternoon! The food at the Washington Irving was well above our expectations with the wide variety of cakes at the breakfast buffet being particularly delicious.…

title: Unexpectedly lovely hotel
review: Great hotel just outside the Alhambra walls.  Very modern, great wheelchair accessible room, friendly staff, wnderful breakfasts - what's not to like?  The hotel is quite small (63 rooms I think) and, at least when we were there, no coach tours.  The restaurant, bar and terrace are all wonderfully peaceful.  Great food too.    Lovely.

title: All look impressive but service and customer service severely lacking
review: The hotel looked modern, classy but anything but!!! It's all a facade. Location is great for Alhambra, Hotel appeared 5 star and classy. Hotel leaves something missing. 2nd day i reported to reception a leak from bathroom the room above. I got re-assured maintenance had looked and said the leakage resolved. To my horror, the leakage happened again. I almost slipped and fell on the floor. The following night i got moved to another room on the same floor. Barely no apologies or word spoken when i checked out. Over 1 month has passed, the hotel has charged to my credit card for a parking fee when i did not bring my car! 7 days has passed and no refund but a limp apology. Still no refund; is this how a supposed 5 star hotel behave and conduct a complaint??

title: Kevin T
review: I would like to say that this hotel was good value for money. The staff where very helpful and quite unusually the bar prices were very reasonable. As for location we found it was a really nice downhill walk (15/20 mins) walk to the centre, which has a great number of bars and Tapas bars, really enjoyed the beautiful city of Granada, we will see u again

title: Nice hotel but not a 5 stars !
review: The location is definitely the advantage of this hotel, just across the famous Alhambra. From this point you can easily reach the city centre with the minibus C30 or C32. It is also possible to go by foot ( 15-20 min ) but the return will be hard ( steep climb ). The taxi station is nearby and a ride costs 5-6 Euros. The touristic train starts from here but it's not worth the money. The audio-guide is useless ( more music than comments ) and the train is so uncomfortable that you will get back pain in place of informations about the city.  The Eurostars is a well designed, very clean and lovely hotel but the negative is essentially the poor service. The staff is rapidly overwhelmed and sometimes you may wait a long time for small things. Our experience at the bar was…

title: Extremely rude bar keeper
review: Was stopping at this place to have lunch with the family after a visit to the Alhambra. I have encountered one of the rudest services I have experienced so far in the Spain. Especially the attitude of bar keeper everything than customer oriented.

title: About that Wine...
review: We’ve been traveling through Spain and have stayed at Eurostar’s in route from San Sebastián to Granada. Ascetically, we love them. They have beautiful facilities with modern design and an attention to detail that is impressive. But, the service has been merely good, not *great* and it isn’t consistent or anywhere near as congruent as their properties are visually.   To point:  Inconsistent bath/robe/tea station items resulting in calls to housekeeping.  Lighting/HVAC in room not easily managed resulting in more calls “for help”  Breakfast buffet is nice, but while breakfasting asked for WiFi password and was told to go to reception desk to get it ( what?)   At Bar, bartender was openly hostile when we asked him if he would make a recommendation on a bottle as the offerings  “by…

title: Great Location if Visiting the Alhambra
review: I visited Granada specifically to see the Alhambra so this was a great hotel for that. However, it is a little ways from City Center, though there were several buses that came and went quite frequently so it was too inconvenient to get around. My room was very nice with a view to the courtyard. I had breakfast included which why only four stars because the breakfast was just so-so. My omelets both mornings was really overcooked and not so nice. Actually I could have left off that expense and enjoyed breakfast out in town. The receptionist was really helpful in showing my how to walk through the park to town which made the walk so much shorter. But returning in the evening after walking all day I had to hop on a bus because the walk would have been a bit up hill and I was…

title: Luxury, great service & perfect location
review: This 5 star hotel met every expectation.  The staff were all outstanding especially Cristina.  All of our questions were answered with a smile & endless patience.  The location is perfect if the focus is on visiting Alhambra (5 min walk to main entrance or Puerta de Justicia closest to Nasrid Palace).  The room & bed are very comfortable.  The shower is amazing!  There are supplies to make tea & coffee in the room. Air conditioning worked fine in room plus reception & restaurant had a comfortable temperature.  We ate at restaurant our first night due to late arrival & pizza/pasta were fine with excellent service & reasonable prices.  The cold fruit infused water was a welcome treat at reception in the warm early October weather.  Take some time to explore the library & history…

title: 5 Star ratings but 3 star facilities - lacks good air-con
review: The location should not be an excuse for being complacent about giving great service. A 5 star rating is deceptive - the communal areas of the hotel were too hot and and air on was off and the air con in the room was almost useless. The room was on the verge of being uncomfortable and the fan was very minimal with only a trickle of air. The centralised system means that guests don’t have proper control of the temperature in their room despite the wall mounted control which seems to be irrelevant. I requested an iron and ironing board and was delivered an iron on its own.  I rang reception and was told that the board was in use and told to use the bed as a replacement for the ironing board. Is this really 5 star service?.  Ironing facilities are amongst the very basic of hotel…

title: Worst experience ever!!! Be careful they might sale your booking to other hotel!!!!
review: We booked a junior suite with Alhambra view 3 months ago through Agoda and fully paid in advance. When we checked in, the lady in counter just told us it’s fully booked and there’s no room for us and we have to be moved to the other hotel assigned by them already !! What’s the hell? I was speechless and the lady looked at my face calmly and asked “don’t you understand English?” I responded angrily because I surely understand every single words she said but I cannot understand how this thing happens in a 5 star rated hotel? She said vaguely it’s because there’s some trouble between them and Agoda. If it’s true, they should inform their guests in advance and give them the choice to refund the money and book the hotel of their own choice. On the contrary, the took your money, in…

title: Mixed experience
review: A bit disappointed that when we booked through the official website it redirected us to the Chinese version, which seems to be an outsourced provider. That was counted as our bad luck then as we could have booked through the English website and got free breakfast and water!  There were 7 flies on the ceiling. Glad we kept some light on at night so they didn’t really move!  Shower area was a bit small compared to the large bathroom.   Room was quite modern and looked new. The tv was wayyyyy too large given the room size but we would gladly take it.   The best part is the location of course which is so close to the Alhambra Palace.

title: Romantic trip to Andalusia
review: I tour of Andalusia would be complete without the Alhambra and this hotel is the closest to the gates. It is ranked 5-Star and generally lives up to its rating friendly staff (maybe a bit young and I experienced but not to the point it was a problem). We got a junior suite and the Alhambra was literally right across the street. They have a full bar and restaurant, swimming pool, sauna, and available massage. I took advantage of that. Loved the shower combination of overhead, waterfall effect, and handheld. Includes bidet.   Beds comfortable and a wide array of pillows available. We chose memory foam. On our final night we returned to the room and were met with a rolling tray with a nice plate of fruit complimentary for last night.

title: Location, location,location
review: Fabulous hotel in the perfect location. Ideal for visiting Alhambra. After five hours walking around Alhambra the hotel being so close was fantastic. Staff very well trained and courteous.Can recommend this hotel highly.

title: Wonderful stay!
review: My friend and I stayed here on 6th September and we loved everything about this hotel! From the moment we arrived we were struck by the friendly staff and peaceful environment. The hotel is very stylish and even has a rooftop pool and bar. Gorgeous room with a fantastic bathhroom with twin sinks, bath and the best rainfall shower we had ever experienced. The food is excellent too. We had some delicious tapas and breakfast was superb. Perfect location for the Alhambra, 10 mins walk to Plaza Nueva just a bit longer coming back up the hill but you can always catch the bus. Wish we had stayed longer!

title: Perfect hotel, right next to Alhambra
review: The hotel has an unbeatable location, right next to Alhambra. The service personal was exceptional. They openly offered to help with planning a great surprise for my wife. Thank you !!! The breakfast was also very good. Rooms are very well organized with everything you need, and amazing bath.

title: Excellent location
review: We stayed at the Washington Irving in early August.  The location is great, directly across from the Alhambra.  It is walking distance to town (downhill) and on the way back you take a bus or taxi.  The hotel was very nice, the rooms were modern and even a quaint swimming pool.  The only problem was that we had ants in our room and changed rooms but he second room also had ants.  I think this is a problem in the south of Spain at this time of the year as we had the same problem in Seville. But regardless they need to find a solution. Everything else was great but because of this I can't give them a higher rating.

title: One on the best hotels
review: Stayed in the Andalucia suite,greated  with delicious pinacolada at arrivals,very good location for those who planning to visit Alhambra Palace.Walking distance at the right is the main gate to get the tickets, walking distance to the left to get into the palace through the justice gate.The hop on bus across the street.Walking distance to the city centre.Nice spacious suite two rooms with large family room,well supplied,the breakfast is nice specially the outdoor area.the staff so nice specially seniorita Cristina was so sweat, helpful and professional ,we wish her and all of you the best.

title: Fantastic for the family
review: We stayed at the Eurostars as the family room looked like s good option (4 of us travelling) and we were not disappointed. We had a junior suite with an adjoining room. It was very spacious and meant 2 bathrooms which is handy. The location is perfect for visiting the Alhambra. We had tickets booked for 8.30 for the Palaces. Had breakfast (which was included) and headed down to the justice entrance. Probably could have left at 8.15 and still arrived on time but was paranoid! There are plenty of signs showing you where you are so it’s not too tricky. The main entrance is only 2 mins up the hill. We went to a concert at Generalife at night so that was convenient. It’s about a 15 minute walk up or down the hill to town which we walked a few times (legs were a bit sore the next day…

title: Disappointed
review: My husband and I chose to stay here for a special birthday visit to Granada. I must say the hotel is in a fantastic location and the room we chose was a deluxe superior with terrace. Unfortunately when we were getting ready for bed on our first night we noticed we had ants on our bed! We discovered they were coming in from the terrace and climbing up the wall. We were then given another ‘basic’ room with twin beds to sleep in for the night and a promise to clean and spray our deluxe room for the following nights stay.. unfortunately this was not the case and again at midnight my husband and I were moving rooms due to ants. Although we loved our time in Granada our stay at the Washington Irving was extremely disappointing. To make matters worse on checkout we were told that only…

title: Superb
review: What a delightful hotel. We couldn’t have asked for more from the friendly staff, gorgeous suite and wonderful breakfast. The location so close to the Alhambra was excellent. Drinks at the bar were relaxing and room service was most efficient, though next time I would ask for the pasta dish to be hotter.  We would not hesitate to highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Granada!

title: Great hotel
review: We wanted to stay close to Alhambra during our visit in Granada, because we had tickets both for day and evening entries. This hotel is as close as it gets. It was easy to drive to the hotel with our rental car, and they took care for the car for us (there aren't many places to park in the area).  Breakfast was good, and we tried the lunch menu as well. The city center is reached by walking down the steep hill. A lovely walk, but you may want to reconsider if you have a difficult time walking a lot.  The hotel has a rooftop pool. It was not very clean when we visited in march. The staff probably though no one would swim in this temperature, but we would have if the pool had been clean.

title: Great stay
review: It seems like the building itself has been renovated recently. The hotel is beautiful as well as the decoration. The breakfast is excellent and the food in the pool area as well.   Everyone in the hotel is extremely friendly and happy to engage with you at any point. They genuinely try their best to please you.   The hotel is located within 3 minutes of the Alhambra by walk.   By far this is the best Eurostar hotel I’ve ever stayed. After Granada I went to Córdoba and it wasn’t as good as this one.

title: About Eurostars Washington Irving
review: Great experience: allocation, decoration, Staff behavior, breakfast, rooms details and one incredible and fantastic swimming pool (...probably this is not a reason in Winter...) ...I will back for sure!

title: Loved it
review: Great location, lovely rooms with very quiet air-con and amenities, excellent well informed staff, great buffet breakfast, valet parking worked a dream and rooftop bar was great for cooling off in . All in all a perfect hotel from which to explore Granada for a few days..

title: Really a 4.5!
review: The Washington Irving is located about a 3 minute walk from the entrance of the Alhambra.  The location for that could not be any better.  It is not located in the city center however so you should decide where you will be spending your time.  The C-3 bus runs from the Alhambra to the city center, right by the hotel, and with cabs being pretty cheap, about 5 euros each way, the location was right for us.  The BEST things about the hotel is the nice pool they have.  After a long afternoon of sightseeing, the pool was great!  Also the staff of the hotel is absolutely first rate.  They were helpful, not only with issues related to the hotel, but also in helping us address a flight issue we had, recommending places to eat or places to shop, and were extremely professional.  The…

title: Very good
review: We stayed for two nights for visiting Alhambra and the old parts of Granada.  The hotel was beautiful and well designed  and the breakfast was good, 18€. The stuff was very polite and friendly. I would have given five stars if the WIFI would have been better and the swimming pool bigger.

title: Washington Irving would have loved to stay here!
review: My husband and I spent two tourism-packed days exploring Granada and the Alhambra. Knowing that the city is hilly and not always easy to navigate, we sought a 5-star hotel online that was in the best possible location. We found it, for sure! This Eurostars hotel was a bit disappointing on the outside, with an unassuming exterior, but inside the recent renovation was more than satisfying. Our room was not what I would call spacious, not compared to other 5-star hotels, but we did not request an upgrade and were satisfied with the soothing pallet and modernist vibe. Likewise the bathroom was accommodating but not grandly spacious. Now, wouldn't one expect a turn-down service, 'free' water, and maybe even a bon bon on one's pillow after a day of touring in high 'thirties temps?…

title: Fabulous staff and hotel
review: Friendliest most helpful staff fabulous  From the moment you walk in to your departure they are incredibly helpful and friendly. The hotel is wonderful just a 3 minute walk from the main gate to the Alhambra and the city tram tour almost directly across the street. The pool area is on top and required going up some outside stairs but Eady to navigate. Pool is salt water and very nice as is the pool.area. we canned into the old city and cabs cost about 5 Euros well worth it Alhambra park directly across street. Rooms large and very nice.   Loved this hotel

title: ULTRA-MODERN AND BY THE ALHAMBRA
review: A very modern hotel with a rooftop pool situated just about as close as you can get to the Alhambra Palace complex. The reception staff are most helpful. The rooms are furnished and equipped to a very high standard. There’s a courtyard where you can find shade for much of the day. Excellent buffet breakfast. Valet parking makes use of a nearby car park. Access to the remainder of the city is down a long shady pedestrian tree-lined walk: what goes down has to come up which takes rather more effort but, all round, an excellent choice of hotel.

title: Almost 5 star
review: This is an excellent location for viewing the Alhambra as it is directly across the street. We had a view of it from our window. The lobby and the restaurant/bar and the rooms are modern and roomy. The bathroom had a separate tub as well as a rain shower. The bed was king size with luxurious linen. We did not think the hotel deserved its 5 star rating because of the lack of attention to detail in housekeeping. Items removed from the honor bar were never replaced. At one point I had to go to the front desk to request more coffee packets as they were not replaced each day. We stayed three nights so replacements were in order. The price charged was in keeping with the 5 star rating, but the hotel did not live up to it.

title: Amazing hotel and next to the Alhambra
review: We stayed three nights at the hotel and we highly recommend staying here. The hotel is practically brand new and it is clean and luxurious. A visit to the Alhambra is mandatory while in Granada. Well, the Alhambra complex us just across the street. So there is no need to rush if take a taxi if your tour starts early. You can also walk down to the city without leaving a beautiful park located across from the hotel. So walking all the way to the city is easy and using the easily accessible trails of an amazing park. The breakfast at the restaurant is good but expensive. A better option is to buy pastries when in town and bring them back to the hotel to have breakfast. While in Granada do not forget to eat Churros con chocolate. The churros in Granada were better than in other…

title: Almost perfect
review: I honestly really liked this hotel. I thought the aesthetic was really nice and the modern style of the lobby was very appealing. The service was really great from what I experienced. The guys at the front desk were super nice especially this one dude named Alberto. The rooms were pretty small but I didn’t mind because we were only there for two nights. The biggest issue we had was that our rooms were four rooms apart because our suite was cancelled. I mean it worked out in the end but that was kind of disappointing. Overall though I really liked the hotel.

title: Can’t fault
review: Excellent location for the Alhambra, Albaicin and for the old area of Granada most are interested in etc. Cannot fault room, helpful staff, breakfast very good. Down a quiet road so we had undisturbed sleep. Pay for parking but they drive it away for you so no concerns finding space.

title: Super city hotel with rooftop pool
review: Stayed here in June for one night. Virtually opposite the Alhambra. Very friendly and efficient staff. Fabulous buffet breakfast and great rooftop pool and bar. Valet parking 18e per day but worth it - would definitely stay here again.

title: A gem of a hotel
review: This hotel offers everything to make your stay very comfortable indeed. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent rooms. Delicious, top quality food in the restaurant -especial thanks to Moisés who made our meals memorable with his recommendations and attention. Fantastic location -opposite Alhambra and ten minutes walk to the centre. Will certainly stay again and would recommend it to friends and family.

title: Very tasteful
review: This hotel is lovely but decor is a little dark so my not suit the visually impaired. The rooms are well appointed and the location could not be better for Alhambra Palace.  There is no car parking at the hotel but valet service is availabe at €18 daily rate.  Breakfast choice is good and staff all very pleasant and helpful.  Automatic toaster (Kitchen Aid) has too many buttons with icons that don't seem to mean very much. I needed assistance which is embarrassing for a guy with a degree in Electrical Engineering. If we were in Granada again, I would book this hotel as it is in a really tranquil location but only a short walk to the city centre albeit down a steepish hill. Taxi back up hill from main square only €5 - money well spent after an afternoon at   one of many local…

title: Superb hotel, room, breakfast
review: Just opposite Alhambra you find this hotel. What did I enjoy it, service is very good, rooms are very good, breakfast is very good and it has a small pool and roof Terrace. Small notes: not all staffmembers did understand english and lunch is not That good

title: Our favourite hotel over our 3 week trip
review: We chose this hotel for its close proximity to the Alhambra Palace - in fact just across the road,    Quite a trendy, minimalistic  hotel inside with a lovely pool and bar area.  We had a problem with our shower on the first night and straight away we were helped to move to an upgraded room.    Superb breakfast - it had everything.  My favourite breakfast of our trip.  We had two lunches by the pool bar and dinner one night in the restaurant.  Excellent food and excellent service and in fact my husband's pudding was to die for.    Everyone we dealt with in this hotel  was very pleasant and helpful and certainly a credit to the hotel.  Great stay.

title: so disappointed
review: I asked if possible for a room with a view (garden or pool etc) we booked months ahead yet met people who had booked  a few days before, at a similiar rate and got the view. We had booked the hotel as it was close to Alhambra as I cant walk a long way after chemo- hence when resting a view is nice. We actually got NO VIEW at all, just a look at another window with bars on it. Checkin was very friendly but after that standards dropped. the bar and restaurant was way understaffed with one person managing both, so we gave  up trying to get a drink and waited a long time for lunch. This was the only hotel on our European trip that disappointed.   breakfast was ok

title: Nice hotel, in front of the Alhambra!
review: The Washington Irving Eurostars hotel is perfectly located to visit the Alhambra and the city center of Granada (walking distance).  The nice rooms are very clean (big tv screen), with a nicely decorated bathroom (rainshower).  A rooftop sundeck with a small swimming pool and a poolbar is the perfect place to relax after a walking tour in the city center or the Alhambra. Even though a few more sunbeds would be appreciated by the guests.  We enjoyed the breakfast with a varied offer of cheese, ham, fresh fruits and bread.  If you visit Granada by car it’s good to know the hotel has a private parking with valet service.  We appreciated the friendly attitude of the staff.  Highly recommeded!

title: Perfect location for The Alhambra
review: Stayed at 5* Eurostars Washington Irving for two nights whilst visiting Granada and The Alhambra, Very conveniently located, modern and well furnished. We were located on the third floor which was very quite and overlooked the restaurant patio area. The room was clean, comfortable and the bathroom was modern and well laid out. Breakfasts were excellent with a good buffet choice and made to order eggs. We had dinner both evenings and the menu choice was good, food quality was excellent and well presented. The staff were all very helpfull, friendly and attentive. Was surprised however as is expected in a 5* hotel  that a daily bottle of water was not provided

title: Great stay
review: great location, quiet place. almost in front of Alhambra entrance and about 12 minutes downhill to busy historic downtown. After hours of walking in the Alhambra it was good to have  the hotel just in front of it.      Rooms are spacious, modern, quiet, good sleeping bed and quiet air conditioner. Great shower.     Restaurant for dinner deserves an special comment: It was a hidden gem. We decided to try the first night and end up having dinner every day in the hotel. It was peaceful and quiet. Special attention to the service where Moises run the place efficiently. Food was very good and prices similar to many restaurant in the old historic center. Most of the restaurant in the historic center are packed, noisy,  not cheap for the quality of food offered,  for the simple…

title: Comfortable room and fantastic location
review: The location of this hotel was perfect for us. The hotel is across the street from the Alhambra and tucked away from the noisy Plaza Nueva. The walk from the hotel to Plaza Nueva was serene. The hotel lobby is beautifully decorated. There is an outdoor seating area to soak in the sun. The fourth floor has a swimming pool, gym, sauna, and changing room. The bar on the fourth floor was closed during our stay. At check-in, the front desk recommended a few popular restaurants. Our room had a nice warm decor. There were different master setting for the lights in the room (relax, work, welcome, sleep). The fridge was tucked away in a closet that was not easy to find. They do not provide complimentary water for making coffee and the cleaning crew took away the water bottles we bought.…

title: Nice enough but not a five-star hotel
review: Self described as elegant and romantic, it is neither. It’s a very decent functional hotel. The staff is very good. The rooms are nice but nothing special and certainly not luxurious. My room is very dark which makes staying near the Alhambra nothing special.

title: Great staff, greatlocation
review: This hotel is within a comfortable 5-10 minute stroll to the Nazrid Palace and the whole Alhambra complex. The rooms are very nice, including excellent shower and bath, etc. Lovely breakfast. Overall, however, it is the staff who make this place a cut above the average. The reception staff do a good job of seeming to know their guests and Rosa deserves special mention for orienting us on the city, the sites, and, critically, the buses for those uphill climbs to Albaicin and back to the hotel.

title: Great rooms!
review: This is a great hotel located directly next to the Alhambra.  The room was VERY comfortable and everything exceeded expectations.  I got a great rate booking the day of for two nights.  The buffet breakfast is very nice too.  When you're travelling for a while and you want some modern comforts - stay here.

title: Five minutes from Alhambra
review: The hotel is well located for visiting the Alhambra and a reasonable distance from the bars and restaurants in town- there is a network of stepped paths leading to the centre.These are quite steep coming back but there is a regular bus which runs until 11pm and the taxi service is readily available. The room was clean and a good size.  Food in the bar was fairly ordinary, for example a club sandwich at lunchtime was generous but not special and the avocado salad was plain- just a collection of ingredients on a plate. Breakfast buffet was good and worth taking at the hotel if you are going straight to the Alhambra, but otherwise walk into town and find a cafe with much cheaper options. The thing that sets the Washington Irving apart is the fantastic customer service and well…

title: Nice room, good location, friendly staff
review: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in April 2018. Our room is quiet, modern, clean and large with a king bed, a small sofa, a desk and a chair. The bathroom is good size with a tub. a separate shower and double sinks although the sinks are small. Our room has a view to the nice outdoor area outside the bar where we hung out and had a drink.  The hotel is right across from the Alhambra. It is a short walk uphill to the Plaza de la Alhambra entrance or a short walk downhill to the Puerta de la Justicia entrance.  There are several restaurants and stores within short walking distance of the hotel. It is not far to walk downhill to the city center. But it is pretty steep walking back uphill. You can take the C3 bus which stops near the hotel.   The staff was very nice. One staff…

title: Great staff, great location
review: This hotel is really good. Rooms are a good size and wonderfully furnished. The hotel is 100m from The Alhambra so point to note is it is up the top of the hill and any walks into the city, which only takes 10 minutes, can be slow and tiring if not fit.  The front desk staff were exceptional. I wish I had remembered the name of the gentleman who took time to share his thoughts on the best places to visit ( he wore glasses is all I can remember!).  The rooftop pool is good and the gym is fine with nice views of the surrounding area.  The only thing that could be improved is the WiFi speed.  Would highly recommend.

title: Great location, Excellent customer service
review: We have stayed there for 2 nights, the location is very good it is right opposite the Alhambraand which is very handy and it is 15-20 walk to town and the shopping area, it is a nice walk through a lovely park.The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very nice and well furinshed, breakfast was so good, lots of choices and excellent coffee.

title: Truly classy
review: Had two nights here in April. Everything about the hotel oozes class. Great staff. Great rooms. Location is A1 right opposite the Alhambra. Daughter loved the gym. Easy valet parking. 5 star in every respect.   I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Granada.

title: OK, not amazing.
review: If you're in town to see the Alhambra, this hotel is ideally located.  If you want to explore the town of Granada, this hotel is quite isolated.  Desk staff was kind and helpful.  No door staff, so expect to manage your own luggage (which is a bit of a pain on the cobblestone out front).  Hotel decor is nothing special and amenities are fine, but definitely not luxury hotel.  Rooms are fine & pretty clean, but not at all special.  Not really worth the price.

title: Luxury and Location!
review: Arrived to Granada via Bus from Malaga. Easily hailed a taxi outside the bus station. It felt like we drove away from the city to the top of the hill, however the surprise was how amazing and convenient the location of the hotel was.   A luxury hotel located immediately outside the walls of the Alhambra, truly incredible! Our room was ready upon arrival around mid-noon prior to standard check in. A short 5 minute walk and we were within the walls of the Alhambra and were able to explore all day.   The walk to center city is about 10 minutes down the hill from the hotel, closer than it could even seem. The walk to Sacromonte and Albayzin is stunning from this location, behind the walls and through the paved hills of the Alhambra about 15-25 minutes away depending on your pace.…

title: Great choice in Granada
review: Perfect location just across the street from Alhambra. The place looks brand new (even though it’s been there forever) and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again when in Granada. Note that there’s no parking on the premises- you have to use their valet service if you arrive by car.

title: Very nice hotel
review: The hotel was exceptionally clean and quiet. King bed was very comfortable. There was large bathtub and after walking all over Granada for two days,  it was so nice to soak in a hot tub at the end of the day. The location was right near the Alhambra and also near a bus stop so we could go down into the neighborhoods to eat and have drinks. Only ate at the hotel once for breakfast and it was good.

title: Comfortable, convenient hotel
review: Stayed for 2 nights in the Eurostars Washington Irving hotel.  The room was lovely and the bed (including pillows) was one of the most comfortable hotel beds ever.  Very relaxing stay - our room faced the back of the hotel.  The staff were very polite, friendly and helpful.
