It is very conveniently located across the road from the Alhambra and is a short walk away from its' entrance.  There is a small shop located uphill from the hotel.  The centre of Granada is located ~10 mins walk down a steep hill.  Would have given it 5 stars except that the toilet had not been properly flushed before we checked in which was unpleasant.

title: Great hotel across the road from Alhambra
review: Stayed two nights in a first floor room almost directly above the entrance and facing the Alhambra. This is a really nice hotel would have been five stars except for a few issues. 1st parking you have to park on the Alhambra car parks which costs about €20 a day and is a bit of a walk (uphill) they do offer a valet service for an extra €18 euros, I think that's a bit steep. 2nd breakfast, pretty good but one coffee machine which means queuing and it ran out of water etc. 3rd gym it's only a few cardio machines and was very warm inside and lastly the air con, we couldn't get it to work and we overheard other guests with the same issue. Having said all that, I'd still stay there again as overall this was a good hotel. Clean, comfy huge bed in a great location. Staff also very…

title: Well positioned, quiet hotel with very comfortable room and good service.
review: The hotel was very well placed for the Alhambra and  a lovely, traffic-free walk into the town. The staff were very helpful and pleasant and our room was quiet and comfortable and very well looked after. Breakfast was excellent and very varied The only drawback was that on the third night our meal was of a much poorer quality which discouraged us from eating there on subsequent evenings. Having said that we weren't charged for the meal, which was good.

title: Not yet ready for primetime
review: We had 3 rooms here for a family vacation.  It is a very clean and relatively stylish hotel and very convenient to the Alhambra.  However, the room layouts are very odd and not very convenient for a traveler.  The light switches are so overly complicated as to be virtually impossible to use, and the air conditioning control does absolutely nothing - literally.  You can push all of the buttons you want, and absolutely nothing changes.  Therefore, you have no choice but to open your windows and being right on the main road across from Alhambra makes that a noisy proposition.  I also did not think the front desk staff was as knowledgeable and ready with suggestions as I have experienced in other hotels in Granada and elsewhere in Spain.

title: The service is what sets this hotel apart
review: The service in the hotel and bar was outstanding. The front desk was very helpful. The rooms are nice, modern, clean, and very well appointed. And of course the location is fabulous if you want to be RIGHT BESIDE the Alhambra.

title: Beautiful hotel across from Alhambra
review: Loved this hotel! Location is perfect, not so close to city center but the walk to and from downtown is very picturesque, although you have to be in shape if you plan to return walking since it is a steep climb back. I reserved the hotel via their website and because of that they gave us a free welcome drink and free breakfast, latter which was wonderful. When you arrive you are greeted by very nice employees, smiling and ready to help. They gave us the room before check in time which was also a nice touch. The room is beautiful, bathroom as well, nice toiletries and they also provide an electric kettle for tea or coffee, perfect. Our room had a small balcony with an amazing view!! Loved everything about this hotel and if we come back we won’t hesitate to book the Washington…

title: Excellent modern hotel, right next to the Alhambra
review: What can I say, everything was just perfect... not sure why it's not a 5-star hotel. It's an excellent modern and shiny hotel, with modern internal design of the rooms and facilities. Bathroom also includes a bidet. Note it's not in the center of Granada, but right next to the Alhambra, which is why you come to Granada at the first place.  The place is generally very quiet, and the rooms are also quiet. The staff was great and helpful. They also parked our car and brought it back when we needed, for 18 Euros a day (a much needed service in Granada). Breakfast was rich and very good. There are 2 elevators.

title: Great stay
review: This is definitely a 5 star hotel without the hefty rates......bathrobes, slippers, comfortable beds, beautiful bathrooms, plus it seems brand new. It is less than a block away from the ticket office of the Alhambra. Valet parking is a major plus. The staff was great and very accommodating.

title: First time southern Spain
review: We have travelled many places, but never southern Spain. We ended booking a trip to Granada, which turned out to be a very positive experience. The hotel is very quiet and calm but due to the busses, only 10 min. from the City center. We would book the same hotel next time. Granada is a very cosy city, and we did enjoy our stay. Good restaurants, friendly people and also the hotel staff were kind and serviceminded.

title: Another great hotel on our travels through Spain
review: We stayed here for two nights during our visit to Granada.  Hotel staff was very friendly and our room was clean and comfortable - easily accommodated a sofa bed for our family of 3.  Extensive and delicious breakfast was included with our rate, and we received great recommendations on dining from the front desk staff.  Location is literally steps from the Alhambra which was very convenient for our 10AM tour the second day.  That also means it is at the top of the hill as compared with City center.  Coming back from the city was a vigorous walk, which was our choice versus tram or taxi.  It did make us think twice though about "walking back up the hill to get refreshed before dinner" on the first night.  Would definitely recommend this hotel

title: Staff really helpful.  Great hotel
review: Stayed during 3 days of torrential rain.  Hotel was lovely and in a convenient location.   Carmen spent nearly an hour getting us tickets for the Alhambra and we had the only half day there when it didn't rain.  Fantastic.  All staff were lovely and so helpful.  Probably could have done with more staff in bar and restaurant on Saturday night but we suspect more people ate there than usual to avoid the rain.  Food was reasonably priced.  Would recommend

title: Wonderful stay for our mini moon
review: Beautiful comfortable clean rooms, modern hotel with Andalusian touches. We didn’t opt for the breakfast and went for a morning walk to the wonderful 4 gatos in Albayzin instead.  The location is idyllic - a 10 Minute walk from the city centre, great to walk off all the delicious food  - inside the alhambra parkland surrounded by trees and fountains.  The pool was small and not a lot of sun-loungers but it was perfect for a late afternoon chill. The tapas on offer are delicious and reasonably priced. We loved it and would come back again.

title: Great views used as an excuse/ las grandes vistas usadas como excusa
review: We got here on 11 March coming down from Sierra Nevada. the view of the Alhambra are great, and the menú at the bar is good as well, and that is where the good news end. It is a shame that a landmark hotel like this is Managed so poorly and with such a service...the Network inside the hotel is very Bad, breakfast is much worse that in a Four Star hotel, the people at reception need a clear wake-up call to provide good service rather than procastrinate with everything.

title: High on the heights above Granada, across from the Alhambra, lies paradise
review: I loved everything - the warm, welcoming anf informative front desk staff. I asked for a room on the upper level with a view of the Alhambra, and received a beaufiul spacious, comfortable room with two sets of French doors, opening to a beautiful view of the Alhambra walls and towers. It's less than a 5-minute walk to the front entrance of the Alhambra. Breakfastsl were abuindant w/great variety and eggs-made-to order and a large selection of foods. Everything in hotel description is true. It would also be a wondrous romantic get-a-way - the Washington Irving is a fitting gateway to the Alhambra-Generalife.

title: Super stay opposite Alhambra
review: Really liked this hotel. Check in was friendly and efficient with time taken to talk us through some useful information about Granada. We were allocated a first floor room facing out the rear of the hotel which meant it was very quiet. Room was spotlessly clean with a large comfortable bed and no maintenance issues to report. Extras included a room safe, kettle/tea/coffee, hair dryer, toiletries, separate bath & shower cubicle, pillow menu.  We thought that adding breakfast was well worth doing. There are few alternative options in the immediate area but, even so, the hotel offering was good. All the usual bases covered albeit with a limited selection of cooked options.  Location perfect for the Alhambra.

title: Great value and location but service just ok
review: We selected this hotel for proximity to the Alhambra and that part was great. It is a short 5 min stroll uphill to the main entrance and you can walk down to town in 20 mins or get a taxi from the hotel. The tourist train (€8) departs from just outside too and this is a great way to see the city and reach the Mirador San Nicholas, one of the best viewpoints, where you can sip sangria gazing out over the Alhambra towards the Sierra Nevada. We got a good b&b rate of €140 and our room was very comfortable and overlooked the Alhambra. So, as a base for exploring its great. But the service was sadly lacking in the small details which a 5 star hotel should have. For example we had to ask several times for the water to be replaced in our room, and it still didn’t happen; we booked a…

title: Excellent hotel
review: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The hotel itself is quite new and in great condition, the room was lovely and spotlessly clean (as was the rest of the hotel). Our room faced the Alhambra and we did not find it at all noisy. The hotel is in a very good location, right beside the Alhambra and about a 10 minute walk downhill to the centre of Granada. It can be a bit of a walk back up the hill after a days' sightseeing however there's a very good bus service that runs from right in front of the hotel, the buses are cheap and frequent so it wasn't an issue. Besides, Granada is a very hilly city so you'll be walking up and down hills where ever you stay!

title: New hotel
review: Love this hotel the moment the taxi stop in front . Clean lines and spacious rooms. Service is great and well located . Quiet room and well location. Good value for money . Would come again to this hotel

title: Excellent location and nice staff
review: Perfect location beside Alahambra. This is helpful as it means it's easy to go back for a short break in the middle of the day. Comfortable rooms and friendly staff. Booking direct seemed to get the best rate and breakfast included.

title: Next to the Alhambra
review: Lovely hotel opposite the Alhambra and very close to the city centre and Albaicin. Would have given it a 4,5 if that were possible on Tripadvisor. Very friendly reception, who generally took their time, but were very charming about it. Amazing breakfast with live (classical) guitar on Saturday and Sunday, which we very much enjoyed. We started out with a room facing the Alhambra, but asked to switch to a room at the back of the hotel, which was much more quiet, with a view of the patio and soothing sounds of a water feature. The room was lovely, with tasteful furniture, and provided everything we needed, including a bath and separate shower. The swimming pool is outside and unheated, so only for dare devils - we tried it after a visit to the gym and sauna, to cool off. The hotel…

title: Family holiday
review: fantastic location in close proximity to the historic sites and the city. good service by the reception and breakfast team. comfortable rooms and very spacious. interior decor of reception and rooms of high standard.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: This is a really nice hotel located next to the Alhambra Palace. Our room was spacious and well fitted out. The en-suite was also spacious with a separate bath and shower. The hotel is at the top of a small hill up from the central town area and is relatively steep. It is a nice walk down into the town but if you have limited mobility or use a wheelchair you may need to use a taxi or bus to get back up.

title: Great hotel, very friendly staff, next to Alhambra
review: The feel of the hotel is really nice, relaxing and welcoming. Very close to Alhambra, 15-20 minutes walk down to the city centre. Rooms are luxurious and quiet, a bit warm (around 25 degrees) when we arrived before the airco was on.

title: Way better than expected!
review: We really enjoyed this hotel, and as it is across the street from the Alhambra, it was already a good thing. However, the amenities and staff were far beyond what we expected for the price. The staff was friendly, helpful and made our stay just great. The breakfast was beyond what we expected, and yet not over the top. Ask for the king sized bed rooms facing the Alhambra, at night it is so pretty. Bathrobes and slippers, of course! Internet is a bit spotty, but ths is pretty normal for a lot of Spain and Portugal,no real issues, but a little slow. We would go back any time.

title: 5 stars
review: The hotel staff in this hotel are extremely great and extremely helpful. The rooms are new and interior finishes are of high standard. If you wish to visit the Alhambra this is the place to stay as it is only a 2 minute walk. Tip: you can purchase the tickets to alhambra at reception. 5/5 stars well worth the money

title: Great Place above Granada
review: Crazy close to Alhambra. Our balconies faced it.   Wonderful hotel. Not cheap but worth every penny.  We will have to come back when it is warmer to enjoy the rooftop pool.   Great room with Alhambra right across the street.  They had a wonderful breakfast, and friendly staff.   Christina at the front desk was the best. She went out of her way for me. I don’t sleep very well and get up early to work if I can’t fall back asleep. The first morning I was up about 5 am and went to work downstairs on the couch in the lobby so I didn’t  disturb my wife. Christina opened the library for me so I could work at a table. The next morning I was up at 3 am and she once again set me up in the library and She went out of her way and got me a cup of tea.   I am in an industry that relies upon…

title: Cheap, clean and comfortable
review: We came to Granada to see Al Hambra palace but instead ended up staying very close to it. This is a gorgeous location, lush green with great interesting views.   The room itself was very comfortable and neat. My kids managed managed well here. We ordered pizza from in-room dining which came a little late and they were kind enough not to charge us. The staff were very helpful and knew a lot about the area. There are only 3 floors so it felt quite calm. There wasn’t a buzz of activity which is something I always worry about with my kids!

title: Excellent stay right next to Alhambra
review: No trick photography, no bait-and-switch, the Eurostars Washington Irving met and surpassed our expectations.  It is in fact, just steps from the entrance to Alhambra (which was awesome, as we had an 8:30 entrance to Nasrid), and a "generous" walk (about 15 minutes) down the Gomerez to the City.  Very quiet, solid doors and solid floors, so we had a great sleep.  Wonderful, full breakfast and a WONDERFUL staff - highly recommend

title: Great location, excellent service
review: We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the Alhambra, just a minute away. This hotel had so much more to offer. The rooms are cozy, clean and comfortable. What made our stay so special was the excellent service. The staff is courteous and always willing to help. The breakfast spread is really good. They have a lot of Andalusian sweets as part of the spread. A special shout out to Moises who walked us through all the ingredients (we are vegetarians) and encouraged us to try the sweets. I am obsessed with Tortas de Aceite. So if you are in Granada you know where to stay and what to try! Can't go wrong with this one

title: Perfect for a one night visit to Granada and the Alhambra
review: We only got one night in Granada, and since we were driving we intended to stay away from the centro or the Alhambra area so we didn't have to drive on streets built in the 1500s.  And yet a quirk in our hotel search ended up getting us a last minute fantastic deal at this great EuroStars place, so after all that we found ourselves waking up in the morning 200 meters from the entrance to the Alhambra.  :)  Granted, that didn't end up being very convenient to the rest of Granada, but you have to choose one or the other, and this worked well for us.  In a town like Granada I usually like small, quaint hotels over modern and posh, just seems more appropriate to the locale.  So this is not what I would have normally chosen - it is a EuroStars chain place, slick and modern, not very…

title: Convenient for Alhambra but no life
review: Comfortable room. Lovely bed and great shower but not much else to rave about.  Breakfast was disappointing especially on Sunday morning when we kept having to ask for things - glasses, juice etc. Reception staff were helpful in explaining about buses etc but would have been helpful to have this on the website. Car access is particularly difficult so don’t bother unless you need one. Bus c3 runs stops near by and runs up and down to the plaza nueva. The tourist sight seeing bus also runs past the hotel. Alhambra entranced are just a few minutes walk.  If you need to be close to the Alhambra then this is an option but if you don’t, look elsewhere.

title: Outstanding service by staff
review: We spent three nights at the Eurostar Washington Irving in November, 2017.  My wife and I were on a leisure trip. As a general matter, the hotel room was spacious, comfortable, clean and well equipped with amenities and other items.  The location of the hotel was outstanding, just a short walk to The Alhambra and a 10 minute walk downhill to the center of the Old Town Granada.  Prices were reasonable.  We ate breakfast each day and had dinner one night. The food in the restaurant was very good, and the service at each sitting was attentive and quick.   The most important aspect of this review relates to the service of the front desk staff. Our luggage was lost enroute to Granda by Iberia Airlines (another story altogether). Thus we arrived in Granada having traveled overnight…

title: True 5star hotel
review: Excellent hotel all round placed perfectly for our visit to Granada and the Alhambra. Beautifully and tastefully furnished extremely comfortable rooms excellent staff. Walk out of door and cross the road and there is the Alhambra plus a few seconds walk and an excellent bus service down the winding streets into the centre of town or if preferred taxis always available.

title: Quiet luxury
review: We went to Granada for the first time, and booked a room at Eurostars Washington Irving. The hotel is just next to the Alhambra complex. Very nice and quiet location, with excellent bus connection to the City center. Just a 5 min ride. The hotel is  a nice 5 star hotel, with friendly staff. We enjoyed our stay, and you like a quiet and nice hotel, this is a good place to stay.

title: Great Location, Great Hotel Great Service
review: The hotel is on the doorstep of the Alhambra.  The rooms are modern, bathrooms clean and well equipped and most important the beds were comfortable.    At check in the desk was very helpful with respect to advice about local attractions.   We also availed of the breakfast which had a wide selection of offerings of fresh foods.   Superior experience.

title: brilliant, accommodating place to stay
review: arrived a day early in schedule and the Hotel team slotted us right in with views of the Alhambra Palace right over the road, food is good, staff very friendly and helpful, roof-top swimming pool, gym and treatment rooms all in immaculate condition. a well set out & run hotel

title: Exclusive Choice Right Next to Alhambra
review: Right next to Alhambra (easy walk to the city, coming back is preferable by bus). Very good facilities, very helpful reception desk, valet service for 18 Eur per day, since no parking at the site. Expansive

title: Both slick and sloppy
review: Modern appearance and really close to the Alhambra;  However haven booked through Booking.com we got there to find no room at the inn. The lovely lady at the desk could not have been more helpful in getting us in elsewhere.  However as things unfolded I am reasonably sure that the overbooking was the hotels error and not Bookiing.com who had confirmation of the dates months earier.  We were able to check in the next day again with extremely helpful front desk staff.   The pool area is small and going up there in the afternoon for a bit of lazing in the sun there was simply no space.  Getting a drink was a problem and barmen had to be summoned in situations where we expected the bar to be manned.  The room was up to scratch for the price and the hotel is properly maintained and…

title: Fabulous Hotel
review: My husband and I spent 2 nights at the Eurostars Washington Irving and wished we had stayed longer.  The  hotel is wonderful!  Our room was lovely and very  clean and had the best shower we had the entire time we were in Spain.  The breakfasts were delicious and included the option to order eggs any way you would like them.  We did, and they were perfect.  We also had lunch in the dining room and it was the best lunch we had on our 2 week travels through Spain.  The staff are so friendly and welcoming and can't do enough for you.  The location is the best part especially if you are interested in seeing the Alhambra.  It is just a few minutes walk up the hill.  After our 3 hour tour of Alhambra, which was outstanding, we were so happy that our hotel was just a short walk from…

title: Almost perfect
review: This hotel is just within walking distance to the Alhambra and just outside the old town. Driving to this hotel will allow you to skip the chaotic road around the old town.  The old town is about 15min downhill walk but coming back from the old town you need to walk up the slop. The room is comfy and cosy. The decorate is modern and one of the nicest one that I have stayed in Europe. Room is clean and huge. The front desk staff are helpful and cheerful. It makes the stay pleasant.   The room rate is on the high side but it worth the room, service and location.   There is no parking in the hotel but they provide valet parking. I booked my room with the valet option. When you arrived, you need to park at a small corner opposite the hotel. After you have check in, the hotel valet…

title: Great hotel
review: This hotel is perfect for the Alhambra as it is just across the road.  But it’s also good for Granda as it’s either a 15 minute downhill walk or a short, cheap bus ride away.  The hotel itself is immaculate, the staff are friendly and the room was spotless. In fact all the hotel was spotless.  We had room 207 which overlooked the Alhambra and my only slight issue was we could hear the buses outside sometimes.  But that’s a minor issue. Overall would highly recommend.

title: Great Location
review: Unless you stay in the Parador or the Alhambra Palace hotel, both very expensive, you cannot get a better location for the Alhambra. It is modern clean well presented and great to stay at. The staff are smiley and efficient.

title: Short staffed
review: This is a nice hotel, on the positive side a very short walk to the Alhambra (5 minutes at worse) and a brisk pleasant walk of just over 10 minutes into Granada for the bars and restaurants.  Staff were very friendly and rooms were fine.  So why only three stars? As some previous reviews have said, the hotel does not have enough staff. No concierge, which I can live with, but the pool bar which is supposed to do food and drink from 12pm - 8pm was left unmanned for an hour plus at a time. I went to find somebody and eventually somebody came up from the restaurant, but only stayed 20 minutes before having to go back downstairs again. People came up later, wanting food or a drink from a bar, but nobody there for them.   There was also no option to ring down to get somebody.  It's…

title: Fantastic!
review: We stayed here as a group of six in early October. The hotel is fantastic - the friendly and very efficient staff told us that they had only been open for a year so everything is pristine. The public areas are spotlessly clean, stylish and lovely and cool which was great considering the high temperatures outside! The breakfast buffet, cooked options also available, was also excellent with an amazing choice and constantly topped up. There is a small pool, gym, bar etc. on the roof. The rooms we had were clean, modern and very well equipped. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. The location is good and our room overlooked the courtyard at the back so was very quite.

title: First Class
review: Perfect location, a short stroll from the Alhambra. The hotel is modern stylish and very clean. Staff enthusiastic and very helpful. I can't speak too highly of this hotel, it provides the perfect base for a short Granada visit.

title: Return visit
review: We visited this hotel soon after its reopening and experienced a few teething troubles back then. However now all seems to be resolved and this is an excellent hotel and the best modern hotel (in a  historic building) in Granada. Best period hotel is of course the nearby alhambra palace hotel! It is in an enviable location directly opposite the alhambra palace itself. Only a short minibus or cab ride down into central granada city. Also possible to walk down although walking back up is rather strenuous as it is up some steep and rather unforgiving streets/roads!  Staff are efficient and friendly throughout hotel. Design is provably best described as modern understated luxury? Lovely swimming pool but this does not seem to be  heated. All of this comes at a price and I would…

title: A Beautiful Oasis Next to The Alhambra
review: My wife and I stayed here for our 27th Anniversary. Across the board, the hotel staff were top shelf. Friendly, conversational, and very helpful, the staff were available for us everywhere (dining room, reception, and housekeeping). The hotel design is ultra modern (and very comfortable and QUIET). Its breakfasts and dinners were among the best we had in Spain (Madrid, Seville, and Granada). Best of all, the hotel is located adjacent to The Alhambra, and the very handy mini bus service (Line #3) offers a convenient 5-minute ride down the hill and into the City Center to experience the Albayzin and Alcaiceria. We've traveled through Europe extensively, and found Eurostars Washington Irving to be near or at the top of European hotel lists. Strongly recommended!

title: Tranquil place next to Alhambra
review: Stayed here for a week, which surprised the receptionist as we checked in, so I guess most people do a couple of nights in order to take in the Alhambra.  For us, we were looking for a comfortable place to chill for the week rather than just passing through.  Plusses include the location.  It is ideal for the Alhambra and a pleasant half mile walk downhill into town.  A bus will bring you back uphill if you don't fancy the return gradient.  The hotel has a pool/rooftop bar, so there's somewhere to sit when you've done sightseeing.  The room was nice, if a tad on the small side, with a comfy bed and adequate storage.  Staff were nice too, particularly on reception - very helpful and good English.  So what's not to like?  The pool was unheated and, given this is a modern hotel,…

title: Best hotel in Granada
review: Excellent service all over. Nice rooms and cosy pool area. Good breakfast. Very quite and the best distance to Alhambra. You can easily walk to the city or take a cab, it will not cost you a lot of money. We will come back!

title: Turn right out front door and walk 5 minutes to Alhambra entrance.
review: This is a luxury hotel in Granada that is a short five-minute walk, with a slight uphill grade, to the Alhambra entrance.  We booked a  spacious room that overlooked Alhambra.  There were two sets of French doors which could be opened at night but wait untill Alhambra flood lights are turned off as the lights were very noisy. There was a lovely cedar scent in the night air.  When closed, we did not notice any traffic sounds as the windows were double-glazed. Very comfortable air cooling system. But it was necessary to insert room card and have the French doors completely shut and locked in order to have the air conditioning. There was a desk with chair, free and fast internet service, fast charging USB ports, double vanity sinks, separate room with a bath (tub), and another…

title: Great comfortable place
review: This was the first hotel on our tour through Andalusia. The hotel is very new and modern. The rooms are beautiful and have a lot of facilities. There is a little pool on the roof wich is very nice after you have spent the day in the town. A little gym as well as a steamroom we used a couple of times. The breakfast is fantastic here.  Just one little thing could be improved. There are not so much beds at the poolside and there is plenty of space to place some extra. The beds are constantly taken and that's a pitty.

title: Brilliant hotel - best breakfast on our Spanish trip
review: We had 3 fantastic nights here - very comfortable room and easy access to town on bus which left every 10-15 minutes just by hotel. The hotel is right by Alhambra so perfect for the star attraction. A short bus ride from town was nice to be a little out of the middle. Fantastic staff and best breakfast on our trip.

title: Wonderful stay
review: This hotel is a gem for visiting the Alhambra, as well as other sites in Granada.  It is exceptionally clean, with lovely common areas (bar, patio, restaurant and rooftop pool).  The rooms and bathrooms are not huge but very nice (and I am a hotel snob), with a sitting area, double sinks and separate shower from bathtub. The staff were wonderful: always cheerful and attentive (including Carmen, who immediately pointed out the key sites on a map during checkin).   It is also surprisingly well priced, particularly given its location across from the Alhambra.  Breakfast is extra, but a good buffet selection.  If you are looking for a more modern, nicely designed, and conveniently situated hotel in Granada, I highly recommend this one.

title: A short but perfect stay
review: My daughter, two teenaged grandchildren, and I spent a week at the Washington Irving hotel at the end of August 2017 and although the weather in southern Spain was too hot for my comfort (it was the only time of year we could make this trip!), the Washington Irving was a perfect place to stay in Granada. The hotel is surrounded by large leafy trees which made it feel secluded and cozy while complementing the hotel's beautiful modern decor.  There were so many things we enjoyed about the hotel, from the fantastic breakfast spread to the amazing service by the hotel staff. The two rooms we occupied were spacious, clean, and well-maintained. The lobby had several comfortable seating areas. The hotel staff were professional, friendly, and very helpful. There was truly not a day in…

title: Location, Location, Location!
review: This hotel is situated perfectly for a trip to visit Alhambra in Granada. The one thing I will say is that the road noise was some what continuous and did wake me couple of times. However the staff were brilliant. I arrived quite late and the gentleman on the front desk was great. Breakfast had a good selection, and the walk to and from the hotel was very manageable. Check out was a breeze and the hotel managed my luggage whilst I attended my tour! A good, easy stay!

title: Overall a great stay, but not quite perfect...
review: First of all, I really did like this hotel and I would definitely stay here again.  The view of Alhambra from our room were wonderful, and the room and bathroom were beautiful, very comfortable, impeccably clean, extremely quiet and fairly spacious. The pool was really lovely, with drinks and tasty bar food available and a very relaxed vibe. You also couldn't ask for a better location to get to Alhambra--about 5 minutes' walk away!  However, the service still needs to be taken up a notch in order to earn 5 stars.  When we came to check in (after dropping off our luggage earlier in the day), there was only 1 couple in front of us who were already in the process of checking in, yet we waited at least 10 minutes behind them without any other staff showing up to help us.  This…

title: Excellent location for Alhambra
review: Great hotel with a 2 minute walk to the Alhambra entrance. The bathrooms are spacious. The staff spoke English which was helpful and they gave us wonderful restaurant recommendations.  We requested parking with our room reservation and that was nice not to have additional fees at checkout. The breakfast was 17 euros which seems pricey, but it had a lot of variety and we needed something convenient because we had an early morning tour of the Alhambra.

title: Lovely beds
review: Stayed here for two nights while passing through Granada. Nice hotel. Fantastically comfortable beds. Very close to the Alhambra so it suited getting up early to queue for tickets (tip: I joined queue at 7:05am for the ticket office opening at 8am and there were approx 70 people ahead of me. I did get to buy the full Alhambra ticket incl. Palace access at 6pm but they sold out shortly after me). Lovely walk down to the city and back up. Bus option available too. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

title: Newly renovated
review: Stunning hotel that is newly renovated and great service. Nice rooftop pool and very modern.  Don't come after 10pm otherwise you will have to park your car yourself at the Alhambra parking lot - only downside.

title: Short break
review: 2 night  family break, hotel had lovely staff, great scenic position opposite Alhambra Palace Nice walk downhill into the main city centre but worth a taxi ride back for €6, Hotel bar was a complete ripoff, 1 x gin & tonic and two large beers €24, considering the price I had to go to the reception for them to call a member of staff to serve you, and Wait 10 mins for service Breakfast was ok, pool nice but sauna was not hot on any of the days I used it Got a good price for room but just ripped off on the bar

title: Brand new not great
review: They claim tone 5 stars not so. Small rooms very nice since it is new. They forgot to give the simple things like extra soap etc. you can ask but why should we have to. At best maybe 4 Stars. The food for dinner was very good. Breakfast was ok this was not 5 star.

title: Memorable stay, excellent hotel!
review: Stayed for a week with my family in this beautiful and modern and homely hotel - everything from the moment we checked in was smooth, professional and led by staff who were incredible and genuine. Service always went above and beyond - breakfast was great with live guitarist on weekends and fresh array of choices.  Location was a short walk from the main attraction of the city (Alhambra) and near plenty of restaurants, desert and coffee shops.  The hotel even had large smart TVs with Netflix in room (kindly set up by one of staff) which was nice bonus after long day of walking and sightseeing all day to kick back and watch your favourite show in bed.  As we had early flight home and would be too early for breakfast staff even went to effort to make a lunchbox pack to takeaway. …

title: Very enjoyable visit
review: We opted for a central hotel with easy access to Alhambra. You can't get much closer than this.  The hotel is very modern inside.we didn't use the very limited restaurant but the breakfast offering was very good. The valet parking is very useful but check they correctly record when you want the car.  The pool is small with a few sun beds but is a very useful addition in this location.  Would definitely stay again

title: Historical Sightseeing Trip
review: An excellent refurbished hotel with an easy access to Alhambra. The tram which runs through the town of Granada is only less than 5 mins away. The hotel straff was extremely helpful to plan our stay and make the best of our time. After a tiring guided tour, we were few mins away from our hotel which was great after being in the hot sun. Located on top of the hill added to the holiday atmosphere. The management needs to work on their sound proof facility as you can hear people outside your room even talking at a distance. Overall an excellent place to stay if planning to visit Alhambra/ Granada. Our daughter loved the big screen TV with all her favourite channels accessible along with UTube.

title: Perfect for Alhambra
review: We absolutely love this hotel. When we arrived, we were served a cold drink while our room was being prepared. The staff showed me a map and pointed out places of interest to me. He suggested going to Mirador de San Nicolas for a good view of Alhambra during sunset. The proximity to Alhambra is the top reason why we chose this hotel and secondly, the sumptuous breakfast. The main ticket office to Alhambra is a short walk away. Perfect to arrive early and avoid the crowds. In addition, we can visit Alcazaba & Nasrid Palace then walk back to the hotel for a nap or lunch before spending the evening at Generalife.  This proximity means it is a bit further from the town areas so it is a matter of priorities- whether Alhambra is more important than entertainment like restaurants and…

title: Best location for the Alhambra
review: This hotel is literally across the street from the Alhambra. We had a reasonable view of it from our room. Our room was nice and we also found staff to be nice and friendly. When we checked in, I was wished a happy birthday. There was also a handwritten note in the room, wishing me good things, which was nice. Valet parking was extra, but we arrived after 10pm, do the valet had gone for the day. This was a bit inconvenient. We ended up parking in the Alhambra car park and walking back to the hotel, which didn't take more than five minutes, in fairness. We left the car for three days. The bill for parking was nearly £60! Parking is pretty expensive in Andalusia, we found. This hotel is a five star one, but didn't have a turn down service. There was also no assistance volunteered,…

title: Perfect stay in great location, high quality decor and facilities, professional staff, good value
review: I believe this hotel was completely rebuilt and opened only a year ago. it is not too big with approx 60 rooms and has the feel of a 'boutique hotel'. Location is great for La Alhambra and the walk to and from town is manageable for the reasonably fit, so glad we stayed here rather than in main town, quiet outside at night.   Standard of decor and cleanliness throughout is very high and our double rooms on high floor facing La Alhambra were large, had multiple windows and separate areas for double sinks, bath and shower/lavatory.   Pool area does have limited seating and shading, but think this is sensible to avoid overcrowding around a smallish pool. This is not designed to be a place to spend all day there so avid sun-worshippers should look elsewhere.  Staff numbers are low…

title: Great location for The Alhambra
review: The rooms and lounge/foyer have been refurbished to an excellent standard. The pool is fine in terms of size although there are way too few sun loungers and chairs and umbrellas around the pool. Given the sun/heat in the area having 8 sun loungers and three umbrellas is way too few to the extent there were people lying on their towels next to the pool because all the chairs and loungers were taken. This I thought was very poor. The gym has minimal amount of equipment. 1 spin bike, 1 life cycle, 1 elliptical and a treadmill which doesn't work. It appears the hotel was trying to achieve a tick boxing exercise with the pool and gym. It's a shame because the rooms are really nice and finished to a very high standard. We didn't eat there as we prefer to eat out. No concierge which…

title: Small rooms, very understaffed, never a 5 star hotel in a million years
review: We had booked for a week and left after 2 days it was so disappointing.   +The location is brilliant for Alhambra.  +The lobby is modern and stylish.  +Some staff care about you and work hard. One privately told me that the management cut back on everything and they don't need to care because they are opposite Alhambra and people will always come here.   -The room we had measured 4m x 3.5m, no balcony. Tiny. Inadequate storage for luggage.  -Parking is 18 Euro per night valet between 8am and 10pm -Expect to carry own luggage to room and back again. -8 sunbeds for 60 rooms around tiny pool. Forget it unless you want to lie on floor.   -1 waiter for pool bar from noon, if you can find him. Do not expect waiter service (we waited 30 mins and gave up). - Don't expect soap or towels…

title: Great staff, perfect local, good hitel
review: The front desk staff are so helpful, amongst the best I have experienced. The hotel is a short wall from the Alhambra entrance and an easy stroll down to town. Modern, clean with a small pool to cool off.., perfect

title: location was key for me to book this hotel
review: 2 minutes away by foot from the Alhambra only! hotel rooms are really 5 star level, I appreciated the valet parking service and the friendly staff at the reception; the check-in time is excessively long (can easily take 10 minutes and more - what kind of crap IT system do they have?) and the pool is poor, very poor.

title: high quality
review: The hotel is located close to th Alhambra, a little bit far to downtown (15 min walking distance). Rooms are new, elegant and clean. Wide enough to have a third bed inside (for my son). This is also a nice swimming pool on the roof. Breakfast is good, but the buffet is a little bit small compared to the ones of same category Staff is kind and always smiling

title: This is not a 5 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination!
review: I would not consider this hotel to be 5*. There are simply not enough staff on duty with long waits at breakfast, the reception desk and especially at the pool bar. On the first morning the choice of food at breakfast was limited because previous guests had already eaten most of it and none was replenished. The two members of staff waiting-on disappeared into the kitchen for long periods of time during service. We left after waiting over an hour for eggs and ham to be cooked and served; they never came. The restaurant was so busy that we could not even attract the attention of the waiting staff. On the second and third days, we were early for breakfast and were astonished at the very good spread of delicious food available. Although the service was much better with only a few…

title: Nice rooms but small pool
review: Chose this hotel because it had a pool and parking. However, the pool is on a very small roof terrace and was very crowded, with not enough loungers and no shade. Several doors off the pool area but not signed as to where the pool bar/sauna/toilets were. Location is good ONLY for the Alhambra, but is about a 15 min walk down then uphill to city centre. Think about how many times you'll be going into town compared to visiting the Alhambra before booking this based on location. Parking is valet parking 18/eur per day which is pretty standard. However car is only accessible between 8am and 10pm and they require 30 mins notice to retrieve it so bare this in mind if departing /arriving outside these times. When you arrive at the hotel there is a small lay by on the downhill side of…

title: GREAT HOTEL GREAT LOCATION
review: This hotel compleated renovations a few months ago and it looks great.Its small,quiet and across from the Alhambra.The restaurant is good the rooms are superb,clean and quiet.The airconditining works perfect.The staff is very helpful and friendly.

title: Good place but between good and average
review: The hotel is super well located, basically in front on the Alhambra ticket counter. From the hotel down to the town the walk is super romantic, you can go via the park, "el bosque de 500 años" or via the street side. Is like 10min distance from central Granada.  The room was mostly clean, however we did say hi to one cucaracha (my wife screamed!) however I suppose is natural from the area.  The service is good, however the restaurant/bar was basically dead during our stay. I suppose most people rather go for the tapas in the town.  Overall it was a good stay. However nothing to go back and do it again in that same hotel.

title: Excellent location friendly stagf
review: Excellent location for  The Alhambra .  The hotel was lovely and modern. It does have a pool but it is  a little small with limited sun loungers.  You can get lunch there which is good.  The restaurant food was ok but nothing very special.  However the waiters were very attentive.  The receptionist was very helpful and couldn't do enough for you.

title: Excellent stay!!
review: Excellent property located minutes from Alhambra. Front desk was helpful with recommendations for dinners. Room was decorated tastefully and beds were comfortable. Rainfall shower was fabulous and we were sorry to leave. Breakfast was fabulous and the guitarist was a special bonus.

title: Great Position
review: This hotel is an oasis in Granada. Across the road from the Alhambra but so peaceful and the roof top pool is perfect to cool down in after a hot day - and it does get hot!  The breakfast is quite expensive so we walked twenty yards up the hill to Jardine Albert which was excellent.  Top tip, book a couple of days on the tour train, for ten euros, early in your trip and use it as a cheap taxi and to familiarise yourselves with the town.

title: Luxury in Granada
review: Great boutique style hotel literally two minutes from the Alhambra. Fab location on a hill so great breezes to cool things down. 10-15 mins walk downhill into town , 5-7 euros in a cab back up depending on the time of day.Very quiet too. We had an Alhambra view room which was perfect. Huge bathroom with tub and walk in shower and the quality of the toiletries was really impressive . Super efficient air con which was almost silent.  Amazing breakfast with everything you could want including perfectly chilled sparkling wine plus red or white.Eggs made to order and served to your table. Great pool with loungers on the top floor with table service, perfect for a dip and a cold beer after a day sightseeing. Really genuine friendly staff throughout. Will definitely book a Eurostars…

title: awesome experience!
review: unbelievable to stay at this great hotel at this price. Located just in front of Alhambra (2 mins?) with a pool and sauna to heal a exhausted body from Alhambra tour. Staffs are so kind, a room is clean and wide compared with those of other Spanish hotels, and Wi-fi is fast. If you don't mind getting to main streets by bus or taxi (you can walk to get there but not easy because of steep) it will be one of the best choices in Granada.

title: Very nice hotel across the street from the Alhambra
review: Convenient modern hotel with spacious rooms.  Very comfortable and clean.  Very helpful staff.  Large bathroom and comfortable bed.  Literally walk across the street to the Alhambra.  Can take the minibus to the center of town by walking 100' up the street.

title: Perfect Hotel to visit Alhambra
review: This is an excellent hotel. The rooms have big comfortable beds, are large and very clean.  The hotel is quiet, the breakfast reasonably priced and substantial with a full range of items. Small plunge pool a delight after being in the sun all day. Staff all extremely helpful and pleasant.  Pre-booking Alhambra a must - also pick up tickets early morning because the pick up system is very slow - two windows serving 100+ people in the line  at 0900hrs.  Distance hotel to Alhambra entrance 250 m - ideal.

title: Excellent location, great hotel
review: It's a great hotel, charming and warm, very well located, just in front Alhambra and to reach the city center it has a very nice path under trees shadow. The hotel facilities are high tech and modern. The breakfast is delicious and complete. We had a lunch at the restaurant and we recommend it.

title: Amazing hotel
review: We stayed here as its virtually opposite the Alhambra. Only a few minutes walk to the ticket office and a lovely ten minute gentle walk to the entrance by the palace. The front of desk staff were really lovely, parking the car no issue 18 euro for 24 hours. The room was so cool and the bed was huge and so comfy. The drive to the hotel very easy skimming the city boundary so no worries about getting caught in the hectic central roads. Very quiet area at night but an easy 20 minute walk into the centre. The paths that surrounded the Alhambra were well lit and felt very safe late at night.

title: 2 min away from the Alhambra
review: Nice, quiet and modern hotel 2 min away from the entry of the Alhambra and 10 min walk from the city center. Room are confortable and clean, breakfast is very good with eggs made on request. There is no parking in the hotel but the concierge will take care of your car ( external parking) don't look for a parking entrance when arriving.

title: Smart well located hotel
review: 2 nights.  Helpful staff, good breakfast comfortable bed and well equipped room. smart decor. Right opposite Alhambra. Easy walk down into Granada. Steps back up but taxis plentiful. Parking off site. Suited us fine.

title: Alhambra on your doorstep
review: Incredible location with Alhambra visible from balconies and taking 5 minutes by foot. We had chosen this hotel due to proximity to Alhambra but what we got was so much more! Staff was incredibly accommodating and facilities were impeccable.

title: high-end hotel near the Alhambra
review: The hotel is a truly exceptional place to stay with a beautiful lobby, large and luxurious rooms, incredible A/C (rare for Southern Spain), and a great bathroom vanity and shower. The drapes were truly black-out. The bed was really comfortable. The views are nice too. It is close to a 5-star rating, but it fell just a little bit short on staffing and hotel amenities. Hotel staff were terrific, but there weren't enough of them. No one around from maintenance in the evenings/nights for routine assistance (e.g., changing a light bulb in a dark bathroom). Staff handled the situation extremely well by offering another room, but we were very happy with our room. Staff simply couldn't be everywhere at once. We came back a bit late close to 2am and found the front doors locked and no…

title: Enjoyable place for a short stay
review: The hotel is very friendly, quiet and cozy, and located just a hundred meters from the entry to the fantastic Alhambra. The room is clean and efficient, very good shower, and the buffet breakfast has perhaps not the richest but good enough choice of dishes. Very quiet and efficient climate control. Rather long and steep walk from the downtown.

title: Good location.
review: Nice staff, gentle and cooperative. Hotel is very well located, just outside the Alhambra. Room was comfortable. The only question was with the WiFi that did not work properly, however this probably was due to the world hamsonware attack that happened during our stay.

title: Splendid hotel & location
review: The hotel was very good and very attractive in its surrounding decor, I particularly liked the quotation art work displayed on the corridor walls which captured Granada and its history. The staff were very pleasant. It was located opposite the Alhambra which was beautiful & amazing and worth a stay just for the Alhambra. Our room was very Attractive in a modern design with a large spacious bathroom and walk in shower room plus a giant double bed. My only trivial criticism is that they should Provide free bottled water and more coffe facilities i.e milk & coffee for the morning etc,  also breakfast at 18 euro was steep and they should have a cheaper option for the light bite breakfast persons, anyway we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it.

title: Right next to Alhambra
review: Beautiful setting right next to Alhambra, which allows you to get to your tour early (and you will need too).  The hotel has a very luxury atmosphere, but through Trip Advisor you can get a more reasonable rate.  They have a pool, which was great in the hot afternoon.  Sitting by the pool with a glass of wine, PERFECT!  Beautiful rooms, weight room, and helpful staff.  I was too tired to walk down the hill for central city (although there is a bus).  So the staff directed us to a restaurant right next to the hotel.  Excellent food and great service.  If you go, stay here!

title: Very Good with Outstanding Location
review: One night stay.   Short walk to Alhambra. Very friendly staff.  Ice cold A.C. for European standards.  Room was very quiet, in fact we overslept due to quiet.  Only complaint was  internet was out (not the fault of hotel, but annoying), and as we had poor cellular reception.  A good place to stay.

title: Excellent hotel
review: This is a five-star hotel through and through. The rooms are comfortable and extremely clean. There are great amenities like a sauna, a comfort room, a reading room a spa, an outdoor pool.  This property is located directly across from Alhambra which makes it very convenient if you come to visit the palace. Just a short walk down the street to the town, we highly recommend visiting the Gypsy Village for a great views and picture opportunities Alhambra and Granada

title: Sadly (And Badly) Lacking
review: First the positives: The hotel is in a great location (right next door) for visiting the Alhambra, the rooms are a really good size with top notch equipment - 60" & 50" tv's in the jnr suite, automatic lighting control, really lovely Hierbas De Ibiza toiletries. The rooms are well priced on the hotel website considering the equipment levels & the included buffet breakfast was really comprehensive with hot dishes (eggs cooked to order) great choice of pastries & breads as well as good quality cava to make yourself a bucks fizz.Valet parking service was a really nice touch & staff at reception were very welcoming & friendly However here is the sadly & badly lacking: We chose this hotel for our wedding anniversary due to its peaceful location away from the city centre (we weren't…

title: Perfect for Alhambra visit
review: A modern, clean, quiet and comfortable hotel with flawless service for a reasonable price. It is in easy walking distance to the Alhambra, and a 5 EUR taxi ride from the city center. Careful when driving to the place with your own car, as many of the streets leading to the hotel are for public transport only.

title: Fantastic location for the Alhambra
review: It's a new, modern hotel only a 5 minute walk to the main entrance to the Alhambra, and not more than a 15 minute down hill walk to town.  We stayed in a junior suite, which was compact but comfortable. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was poorly designed, with a shower and commode together and 2 sinks and bath in an adjoining room.  The sinks were small bowls...splashed all over trying to rinse out clothing, and the shower had no shelf for soap, shampoo, etc.  The breakfast buffet was terrific, but dinner (fish) was lackluster.  Staff friendly, but most had limited English.

title: Modern hotel in quint surrounding!!!
review: Important Advise : -  if you want to walk from hotel to center of Granada, Go through the gardens and don't take either road surrounding the garden.   EWI is a contemporary hotel in a historic town. From location point of view, its 15 min hike from center of town.  We enjoyed the hike but if you are not active and fit then you have alternative to take C3 bus from Plaza Isabel La Catolica which will get you to hotel in 5 mins. Going to town will take 10 min downhill hike amidst gardens. Specially night time walk is so serene and picturesque.   We chose this hotel over the ones near center of town due to concerns about noise during the night time in town and we are glad that we weren't wrong.   Rooms are well appointed and modern with all necessary amenities.  Bathroom has…

title: Good for the Alhambra
review: This was a good hotel with a large room. The restaurant opens at 8 and we didn't see it open for lunch. The breakfast was above average for Spain and gluten free bread was available on request. The room service food was good, but there wasn't a huge variety. The staff was very helpful and the restaurant let us order stuff from that menu and have it delivered to the room, which was great after an exhausting day of walking the Alhambra! The location is very close to the Alhambra, but you have to walk down and up a giant hill to get to the other interesting part of town. There are not really any restaurants in walking distance. There's also a very narrow road leading up with difficult turns and a section that's one way depending on the light so be aware of this if driving! Overall,…

title: Perfect location and worth every penny
review: Stayed here in beginning of may and the hotel was beautiful. It had a very attentive staff, the place was clean, the room was spacious with a lot of detail and confort. The bathrooms were also big with a great shower. The view of our room was right to the Alhambra and it was just a couple minutes away from the entrance. As for the bad... the parking is a little unusual but that's due to the small town. Secondly we were not able to get tickets to the Alhambra even though I thought a 5 star hotel would be able to find a way to get them for their guests, but again... it's understandable they couldn't. Room service was great, the ham was to die for, and the room tv has Netflix which was a great extra. I would definitively recommend this hotel and I hope to come back soon.

title: Excellence, this is what Hotels should strive for
review: Great Location, (next to Alhambra Palace/grounds)  Great Staff, Good Food.   Best Hotel Room to date, In Spain,  every conceivable little extra you could think of was there, even down to our own Netflix :-) on the internet and bluetooth enabled 50 Inch Grundig TV. Excellent WiFi.  Everything was just right, what we both expect from a Hotel room.  When  in Granada a must stay.

title: Excellent in everything
review: The hotel is located right in front of Alhambra castle. The room is very good, the food is outstanding and the staff very friendly. No question about the excellent quality overall.  The tour to the castle it's at walking distance.

title: Ideally located – especially if you are driving
review: We chose this hotel because it was as about as close as you can get to the Alhambra visitor center; even at a slow pace, it would be no more than a five-minute walk. Perhaps more importantly, we selected the Washington Irving because it is very easy to reach by car. Since we arrived after dark, this was especially helpful. There is no need to navigate the often-confusing city streets, and you can leave the car just across the street until the staff parks it for you.  This hotel is clean and modern, the rooms offered more space than is typical in this price range, and our rate included a wide-ranging breakfast buffet. Our room faced the Alhambra – and the somewhat busy road leading past it -- but the soundproofing was excellent, and we heard none of the traffic.  If you want to…

title: Brilliant location
review: Hotel is literally adjacent to Alhambra and 2 minutes from entrance.  Bus C2 stops outside front door if you don't fancy walking up hill from city.  Well appointed modern rooms with bath & separate shower. Great breakfast. Pool on rooftop if you need to cool off.  We arrived by car & valet parking works superbly. They take car & then have it ready for you when you want to leave. You don't need it during your stay.  Can't fault Hotel at all.

title: Get the breakfast package!
review: The hotel is right across from the Alhambra. It is new, modern and clean. The staff is friendly. But the breakfast is unbelievable. The variety at the buffet will leave everyone in the family satisfied.  The only downside is that if you want to go into town, it's quite a walk (on the way back it's uphill!). We didn't mind though. It was only 20 min to get to town and it was good to get the exercise after all the yummy tapas!

title: Quality Business Class Hotel, Adjacent to the Alhambra
review: This is an upscale, modern property that would please any discerning business traveler.  My room was large and quiet, with blackout curtains. The modern bathroom was very well appointed.  The Wi-Fi was very fast.  The hotel breakfast was good, although perhaps not as good as the room.  The live music in the breakfast room was an unusual touch.   The hotel hasn't been open that long, and I did notice a few teething issues, but nothing major and all of which I'm sure will be corrected soon.  This is not a charming, boutique hotel, but it is a quality business class property, so keep that in mind depending upon your preference.   There is an outdoor pool and a small exercise room with four cardio machines.    The location for the Alhambra is ideal, it is literally across the road. …

title: Besides being excelent it is the best place to visit Alhambra in Granada
review: One of the best hotels I've been in regarding accomodation, Staff professionalism and kindness, restaurant quality, decoration and quietness. Also the location is perfect not only to visit Alhambra and Generalife but also transportation.

title: Great Stay
review: Fantastic hotel in a fantastic part of town. Right opposite the Alhambra Palace.  Nice and relaxed atmosphere within the hotel and staff very helpful and friendly.  From a personal point of view this was the ideal part of town to stay. Nice and quiet in the evening. Very pleasant walk in to town. About 10 mins. Nice to experience the hustle and bustle of town but nice to leave it behind when ready.    Room was a delight and very comfortable.  Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect location
review: Great hotel situated perfectly for visiting Granada's Alhambra and Generalife.  The staff was pleasant and helpful.  The rooms were clean, well appointed and quiet.  Would highly recommend the Eurostars Washington Irving hotel.

title: new hotel in fabulous location
review: This hotel is located in easy walking distance to the entrance to the Alhambra. You do not have to go uphill very much.  My room was very new with attractive, modern decor that gave a nod to the Moorish influence of Granada. The bathroom had both a tub and a walk-in shower, and towel warmer. Visually the room was quite pretty; however, I feel that the hotel has some kinks to work out due to its newness. These are growing pains perhaps. Certain things did not make sense. They provided 2 heavy terry cloth robes, yet there was no hook or designated place to hang them in the bathroom when damp. Also the kettle location and electric outlet were inside a cabinet. Thus, the steam from the kettle went directly into the shelf a couple inches above the spout. This will ruin the furniture,…

title: Booked at short notice
review: Beautiful hotel set in the hills close to the Alhambra Palace, polite and helpful staff and only a short taxi ride to the centre of Granada. Very comfortable extra large bed and beautiful toiletries in the bathroom.

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: newly renovated this modern hotel is a fabulous place to stay in Granada. from the point of arrival the service was fantastic with the porter taking care of bags and valet parking. check in was a breeze with bags being droped into room effortlessly. we stayed in a deluxe room and it was spectacular... modern fittings super comfortable bedding with the smothest sheets ive ever slept on. the hotel is positioned next to the Alhambra Palace and the main town is a pleasant 10 minute walk away through the picturesque park. memorable stay and for sure will return.

title: Visit Alhambra
review: Very friendly staff, clean room and great breakfast. Especially the valet parking service was more than welcome. Free wifi worked very well, which should be normal but is not always the case. Perfect!

title: Good hotel, & room, bad breakfast, reception not listening
review: This is a good hotel,  in some ways, but it is not 5 star in any international sense.  Bedrooms with view of Alhambra are large and comfortable.  Reception was charming on check in and check out.  Breakfast was very poor fare indeed and extremely understaffed - Items on the menu were missing, and not being replenished, tea and coffee were hit and miss; special cooked items were not offered.  Prices reflect the view that the hotel is 5 star so be careful of extras ordered, e.g. and indifferent wine was 5 times the prince of a better one down town.   As other reviewers have noted it is a few minutes walk to the entrance of Alhambra and therefore great for an early start.  But do note if you prefer to stay in town the C3 shuttle bus serves the Alhambra every few minutes.  On the…

title: Great visit to Granada
review: Stayed at the Washington Irving for 2 nights. Room was modern and comfortable with a view of Alhambra which is across the street. Restaurant Staff and food were very good. Reception staff were extremely helpful. 15  minute scenic walk to centre of the city, down hill there uphill back. The location makes it very easy to wander the "free" areas of Alhambra at your leisure and convenience.

title: Great stay but....
review: The rooms are great, new and quiet with all the bells and whistles.  The location could not be any better, right across the street from Alhambra.  Friendly helpful staff.  But for a five star hotel you would think that you could have umbrellas for your guests in the event that it does rain, they are not a great expense if bought in bulk.  There were no umbrellas to be had on this rainy weekend!

title: Highly recommend
review: Lovely hotel in perfect location right beside the Alhambra and 5 mins walk (downhill) to Plaza Nueva. Don't worry if you don't fancy the uphill return there is a bus. Very friendly and efficient staff.

title: Superior Rooms and Service
review: The hotels delivers on its promise of luxury with well appointed and comfortable rooms. The staff are exceedingly helpful and make the experience all the better. The location is literally at the door of The Alhambra so for visitors, you can not be better served. It is a 8-10 minute walk down hill to the center of town.  The amenities are first rate with comfortable beds and pillows, well appointed toiletries, and spacious rooms. Rooms on the front of the hotel look at the Alhambra and provide a great view at nighttime.  The restaurant offers an excellent breakfast buffet with standard and local favorites and is well worth it. The pool and fitness area are very good and the pool would be a good retreat during the summer.  The parking is a little difficult. The valet parks all…

title: Great hotel in Granada
review: Really great hotel with friendly and helpful service team.  Fantastic location opposite the Alhambra.  Modern, well sized room and we even eat at the hotel restaurant 9which we usually avoid) and were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the meal.

title: Few days in Granada
review: Everything beautiful. The hotel si completely new and absolutely comfortable. Great location for visiting the Alhambra but also reach the city center. Tiny but nice jym and spa. Extremely kind staff. Comfortable bed.

title: Wonderful hotel
review: We arrived for a 2 night stay in Granada and found this hotel on line.  What a find it was, simply across from  the Alhambra itself and so  perfectly located.  It was €4 to €5 into the city centre by taxi;  I certainly would not recommend driving in Granada.  Our room was lovely.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  I really loved everything about this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone travelling to Granada (itself a fantastic city).  Would I return?  For certain

title: Surprising find - recommended
review: In a way it's not entirely fair to review this hotel as it wasn't where we had booked to stay in Granada - see my review of Casa Palacete 1822 where we were double booked.  However having said that it turned out well as the hotel is very well located for the Alhambra - a five minute walk as well as the city centre. It allowed us to have dinner in the Parador on the site (see my review) and stay late.  Part of a chain of hotels, with the rather off putting ‘Eurostars’ prefix – it is however not a railway train! Don’t be put off by the hotel chain tag, it was an historic hotel well refurbished in a modern chic style.   Parking and check in was difficult - we arrived at a busy time and it meant there was nowhere to park outside except directly on the road and there was a line at…

title: A great surprise!
review: We've had an excellent stay at this hotel and I can really recommend it. The location is perfect if you don't have a lot of time and want to focus on the Alhambra. The rooms are quite big, modern, and very well decorated. The service was really good and the breakfast was excellent, with a big variety of high quality products. I would stay here again. To make it perfect, the only thing missing was a heated pool...but you would not have this problem visiting during summer time.

title: Perfect
review: Very friendly staff. Quiet, peaceful and comfortable.  Very complete breakfast.  Nice shower that is like being under a waterfall. We had lovely garden views from our room and a big and comfy bed.  Will return in the near future.

title: Excellent Stay
review: Very Nice Hotel. Excellent location. Nearest hotel to Alhambra. Not far from town. Local Bus is cheap and very regular service. The junior Suite was perfect for our family. Comfortable bed. Nice décor. Wonderful Bathroom with rain shower. The breakfast was superb. Special thanks to the Lady manager and her staff. Superb Service. The reception staff was very helpful and friendly esp Mrr nd Christine.  Overall an excellent experience with Eurostar Hotels chain in Granada, Cordoba and Malaga during our visit to Andalucia. Will definitely book & stay again. Highly Recommended.

title: Hard to beat for location and comfort
review: I got lucky with a good rate for this hotel which had only been open for a few months when I made my booking so I didn't pay 5 a star price for the luxury. I think the location of this hotel could only be beaten by the Alhambra Parador which is within the grounds themselves. The hotel itself is modern and luxurious though the pool area isn't large and I could imagine that it could become overcrowded in high season. For me in September it was a perfect area to sunbath between sightseeing and because I had booked a night visit to the Generalife gardens it couldn't have been more convenient. I also found it easy to walk down the hill and back again to the town. The path through the woods is well lit, full of people and runners and perfectly safe. For anybody not wanting to walk…

title: Credit checks on guests
review: Not actually stayed at the property nor do I think I will be now. Booked on January 3rd for a junior suite for 3 nights through hotels.com I then notice on the 5th January that the hotel made a transaction on my card for 87p (€1 I assume) was charged a none sterling transaction fee by my bank then received a refund of 85p from the hotel.  The issue I have is not the amount of money your little exercise cost me but the fact this was clearly a credit check a check to see if I was good enough to stay at your hotel. I'm not in a habit of booking hotel rooms to either intentionally not check in or be unable to pay for my stay. Do you do this with all your guests?  I have travelled all over the globe and stayed in numerous top quality hotels and can honestly say this is not a regular…

title: Absolutely Bad Service 2 Star Hotel
review: Walking through the doors of this hotel u are greeted by beautiful decor ,helpful reception desk staff and sadly after that all somehow goes downhill ....understaffing is a big issue at the hotel ...2 staff serving breakfast to all the guests in the breakfast area ,ridiculous how long ppl waited to be seated,food was slapped down in front of u ,u couldn't get anything you wanted ,no one around for long periods of time staff disappear in the kitchen ...then there's the room service ,what we ordered we never received ,ordered Pesto pasta received arabiatta ,asked to speak to the general manager this morn was told he will be in after 1 ,no wonder the hotel is a mess no one is here running it ,no turn down service at night ....no ways 5 star at the most 2 and I'm being generous…

title: Very good location
review: A very good located hotel if you come to visit Granada and want to stay away from the touristic crowd of the old city. Modern interior with spacious rooms.  The restaurant service is excellent  and very client oriented. Even if late and after hours, even if just for two persons opened and set up a table to let us have dinner. Thank you reastaurant team, very much appreciated.

title: Someone was asleep at this hotel....Rip Van Winkle?
review: You are a stone's throw away from the amazingly beautiful restored palaces across the street from you and up a hill literally when you stay at this hotel. It is nearly impossible to navigate the winding, steep and ridiculously narrow ancient streets. Ok. So walk, take your life in your hands with a taxi driver that does know how to get to point B to point A amazingly with safety. It is a thrill to walk some of the steep hilly roads and even a bigger coup when you walk uphill to your destination. The hotel is very lovely and the room that we had was very guest friendly: a bath and open shower, double sinks, closable doorway that opened to your enclosed rain bird shower, toilet and bidet and the hottest towel heater ever! The room had faux wood floors, dark walls, subdued…

title: Nice but difficult to navigate
review: Recently we stayed at the Eurostar Washington Irving hotel in Granada, Spain for 3 nights. The hotel is relatively new or recently refurbished. Overall, our stay was enjoyable, but I do need to point out some issues which the hotel should address and some considerations anyone reading this review should take into account. First, this hotel is located down hill about a 5 minute walk from the entrance to the Alhambra. In fact the outer walls of the Alhambra face you as you walk out the door of the hotel. For those of you like me who did not get tickets to the Alhambra on line in advance or through a tour, the location of the hotel is a plus. The first day, I got on line for tickets for the Alhambra at 645 am and by 930 had moved little on the line only to find out that the tickets…

title: Great stay, great service!
review: The hotel was fresh and crisp.Soothing colors as well as very modern bathroom fixtures and lighting amenities. Did not turn on the tv but it was quite large flat screen Everything worked. The hotel personnel was very helpful, very knowledgeable, and very friendly. Walked down to the plaza nueva to savor the local cuisine and stop by a few drinking establishments

title: Great Location and Service
review: This hotel is in 2-minutes walk from Al Hambra Generallife. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The food was excellent. The room and facilities in general are excellent. The writings across the hotel was a good idea.

title: A Wonderful Stay
review: Ideally located directly across from Alhambra, a wonderfully clean and hospitable hotel. Staff was great especially Christine at the front desk who treated us like family and then Estelle from hospitality who could not do enough for us. The room was wonderful, the hotel was enough to prompt a second visit to Granada.

title: beautiful hotel
review: This is a lovely hotel: very modern (if you want Spanish style, not for you), super-clean, great shower (although rain-shower head is a tad too large for size of shower), arge rooms esp.for European hotel,. good restaurant (great buffet) which is aspiring to be high-end, it has service which needs more training, pool and sauna, very good service. Location is mixed: if you want to be near Alhambra it is excellent, but is otherwise isolated. Considering this is a new hotel (only 4 months), it is top-notch.

title: Outstandingly Good Hotel.
review: My husband and l were staying in Malaga and decided to treat ourselves to a night in Granada. It was November and the weather was perfect at 23degrees for walking. We checked into this fabulous hotel and it was a real wow moment when we saw our room. We really loved it, the bathroom was a dream with gorgeous toiletries and fluffy robes. The bed was the most comfortable l have ever slept in and had exquisite bedding. The hotel is the last word in luxury, and although we were only here for one night we enjoyed every minute. The staff could not be any nicer and every one we came across was so polite and smiley. The efficiency of everyone could not be surpassed. This place is not cheap but it is worth every euro. Highly Recommended. Ann G.

title: MORE EXPENSIVE BY PHONE THAN ON THEIR WEB SITE
review: On September 22, we booked a room in Granada for 4 days for a stay starting the next day. To make sure that there will be no error in the reservation, we decided to contact directly the hotel’s booking service in Granada. Loreta, the customer service agent, was very helpful and booked a room for 4 nights. A few hours later, on the Web site, we saw that the same room was available for 587.82 Euros including breakfast and parking.  We arrived at the hotel the next day, we did share this information with Loreta. Unfortunately, she couldn't match the price offered on the Internet and we have to disburse 726 Euros.  We travel often. This is the first time that a reservation made directly with the hotel does not equal the Internet price. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel, but we regret…

title: Great value at 75 euros, but many service issues.
review: This is a beautiful, modern hotel that's a great location just steps from the Alhambra, and I was surprised how nice it was for the price (75 euros/night). But the hitch is that we ran into some serious service issues: (1) We were initially given the key card to the wrong room. (2) This was our only 2-night stay in one place during this part of the trip, and thus our only opportunity to have laundry done, so we asked a lot of questions to make 100% sure we had it right: Housekeeping would come before 10am to pick up our dirty laundry, and would return it by 6pm. Therefore we were VERY surprised when we left the room at 8am, put the "please clean room" sign on the door, and returned at 1pm to find that the room had not been cleaned and, more importantly, the laundry had not been…

title: Staggeringly Good!
