review: I booked in to this hotel last-minute for one night over the late October/Early November National Holiday in Spain.  I was attracted primarily by the availability, but also by the location - which did not disappoint.  Arriving through the quiet and sheltered Generalife Park is wonderful.  It is a bit of a walk from the Train Station and edges of town but if you're happy with the walk it's a lovely one - and useful after gorging yourself in the many tapas bars you'll find at the bottom of the hill.  The location does guarantee tranquility AND from my room (no special view requested) I could see the walls of the Alhambra which was a real treat.  Inside it is spacious and well lit, clean and very modern.  The staff were exceptionally helpful from the moment I dropped my bags (I…

title: Modern surprise
review: This hotel is in a great location directly opposite the Alhambra. The hotel itself is clean, modern and welcoming. The staff are incredibly helpful and no request is too much. The bar is lovely and the hub of the hotel. My room was super clean with a huge comfy bed and a power shower to die for (maybe a little extreme! 😜). I would recommend this hotel as it's close to Granada city center but  in an area that is quiet and relaxing. I'll be back for sure.

title: Pretencious with no real style
review: The hotel is not a 5 star rating, but they know how to charge. The booking process was an experience, trying to book a room for three nights. Rooms price was advertised on the web at 607 euros, but the system was down. I tried to book direct but this was not processed as they did not have the full card details. Consequently, I booked on the web the next day, because "few rooms were available". to my surprise the same deal had risen to 790E, but this was shown as the "best price available". I then mailed reservations to ask if they would honour the original quote, but after two days they refused. The situation was worse, as by this time, the web price had dropped back to the original low price. Opportunist pricing !  When we arrived, the bathroom was small, dark and the room …

title: A Lovely Hotel in a Great Location
review: We found all we could wish for in this Grenada hotel  We chose a junior suite for our stay and were impressed by the size and amenities in our room. The room was very clean, nicely decorated  had a kettle, bar fridge and large bathroom. There was a very good WFI connection, In our case this was important as my university student daughter had several assignments due that week.Only thing missing  were face clothes. Seems they do not supply those in European hotels. The hotel has a nice terrace adjacent to the bar and dining room. On the top level there is a pool and another bar. There is also a good fitness room. Overall the hotel has a pleasant ambiance and staff were very helpful.  The area around the hotel is lovely, lots of trees and many major sights are all within walking…

title: Splendid hotel in an excellent location
review: This is a very nice hotel with excellent facilities and a friendly staff. Rooms are impeccable and quiet. The Alhambra is at the doorstep which allow you to spend the morning visiting for example The Generalife and in the afternoon the Alcazaba and the Nasrid Palace. The restaurant serves good food but a wider variety of dishes would be welcome. The breakfast will cost you 16 Euro but is one of the best we ever had in a hotel. Every imaginable thing you want to eat in the morning is present. From the map it is easy to see that you cannot park for free anywhere near the hotel so you have to pay for the (valet) parking service provided by the hotel a substantial sum of 18 Euro a day. The website of the hotel and the booking information could be more explicit about this. Our…

title: Wow, Skip This One
review: What a disappointing experience.  The good news started and ended with the bellman, who was courteous and helpful.  Parking is a huge hassle as is unloading your car due to the narrow streets and absence of a place to pull over in front of the hotel.  Parking is listed on the website implying it is covered but it is an extra.  The price for the rooms changed to a lower rate before we checked in but they would not honor the lower price saying it is your bad luck that you booked at a higher level.  Towel drying rack did not work.  Electricity is a chore as the all lights off button also shuts all the electrical plugs except for the bed side lights which is incovenient for recharging ipads and iphones etc.  Only one in room phone and it was without buttons or directions and neither…

title: ok place  terrible policies
review: Dear Guest, As you wrote both reviews, I replied your previus feedback. Best regards,  Ángela Caracuel Manager

title: An excellent hotel but definitely not a 5 star hotel
review: I just checked in paying 229 e and I see on line that the price tonight is 179e  They will make no adjustment.....said I had to be checking every day to see which way the prices went.......also...when it says the room includes parking, it isn't free.   The room was ok...nothing special.  however, the bellman Michael, was so helpful and accommodating.  I would not stay here again

title: Fabulous Hotel a must stay in Granada
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for letting us know about your recent stay at our Hotel.   We are very sorry we have not reach your expectations and we want to inform you that yesterday when I noticed about your request, we tried call you back for inform you that we can make you an adjustment in the price, if you look your phone or e-mail you will check it. However, as the air lines, price are changing if there are more or less people requesting rooms. Sometimes you will find better prices with advance but sometimes not. We are looking forward to see you and welcome again, so that we may have a second chance to show you our philosophy on Guest care. Best regards,  Ángela Caracuel Vera Manager

title: Wonderful new hotel
review: Having seen the old Washington Irvine hotel closed and close  to derelict for a number of years, it is wonderful to see the hotel reopen as part  of the Eurostars group of hotels. Whilst it appears there have been a few teething troubles, this is certainly a quality hotel and with delightful staff. The hotel is very inviting externally and the decor inside is understated luxury- quite a contemporary feel. We will definitely return.

title: 5 star rating but certainly does not deserve it!
review: Just returned from a 3 day break in Granada and hotel was ideal for visiting Alhambra.  We chose it for its rating but were disappointed.  Room not ready when we arrived at 2pm.  Be careful in the pool - it is unfinished and should not be open!  The inside is not tiled and the inside of the pool is concrete.  The circulation spots on the floor stand proud and my husband caught his toe. Tea and coffee making facilities in the room - only thing is there is no milk!  I rang room service and was brought a jug of hot milk.   This however was left in the room for the whole of he two days and the tea bags we used were not replaced. In a fantastic location for Alhambra and the city.  Shame there is not one scrap of reading material or leaflet in the hotel on either!  Surely most people…

title: Extra Special
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for letting us know about your recent stay at our Hotel.  We are very sorry we have not reach your expectations and we want to inform you that an action plan is already in place.  Regarding the reading material about the Alhambra and the city, hotel has a library full equiped in, and you have one channel in the room tv with Washington Irving's works: Tales of the Alhambra. We are looking forward to see you and welcome again, so that we may have a second chance to show you our sound philosophy on guest relax and care. Best regards,  Ángela Caracuel Vera Manager

title: Ideal location, high quality hotel and friendly staff
review: Recently spent two days in Granada and picked this hotel for the convenience of it being next to the Alhambra Palace. The location is stunning and the walk into the centre of the city takes about 20 minutes, it's downhill therefore an incline walking back. Plenty of taxis and buses to catch around the area. Staff very friendly and welcoming, food and service good. Sleek design throughout . The minibar and tea/coffee facilities are not obvious in the room so look to the side of the wardrobe. This is a  top quality hotel, well worth a little extra for that special night or weekend .

title: Excellent Hotel
review: I'm so pleased we chose this location for our 3 day stay.  The location was ideal for visiting the Alhambra, being 2 minutes walk from the main gate.  The 1 Euro small bus that takes visitors up and down the hill between the Alhambra and old city of granada is clean convenient and a short 5 min ride to the main square making it very convenient to explore the city.  The hotel is soundproof, no street noise or noise from other rooms which made the stay feel private and restful.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  The hotel is about 3 months old and build with high quality and tasteful specifications.  Really lovely.  We felt that choosing this hotel enhanced our holiday.

title: Beautiful hotel close to Alhambra (so outside the old town)
review: This hotel is on the doorstep of Alhambra therefore outside the old town. So if you don't mind a 15 minute uphill stroll from the old town choose this hotel ( it is a lovely walk). Hotel is beautiful, rooms are superb. There is no parking but the hotel will park your car for you for a charge of about €15 per day.

title: It's a very comfortable Hotel
review: There were a couple of bonuses to this hotel. One it is almost directly across from the Alhambra (just a 3 minute walk away). Two it was recently renovated and is very nice to stay at.  The front end staff were the best although we found that at all the hotels we stayed at in Spain. The restaurant was okay, primarily the service needs work the food was quite good.  They have a very nice roof top pool deck and bar with sauna. We didn't get to use this area unfortunately but we did scope it out.  One other bonus is if you need to clean out your lungs you can go for hikes up the mountain and get some spectacular views of the city and also the Sierra Nevada's. I personally enjoyed Granada the most primarily because of the added bonus of hiking.

title: Helpful staff,
review: Great value hotel. Nice styling and seems new or newly renovated. About 2 mins walk uphill to the Alhambra. The town is about a 10-15 mins walk downhill however is easily accessible via the local mini bus service (C3 bus) or a stroll up the gentle slope. The walk down the hill through the greenery is serene and cool.  The room facing the street with the balcony was really comfortable. The food at the hotel was poor quality which is unfortunate because the hotel and it's staff are really great. It was my husbands birthday when we stayed and the staff went out of their way to help  organising activities, birthday cake etc. Thanks, much appreciated.

title: Great hotel and location
review: Beautiful hotel and less than 5 mins walk to the Alhambra. Spacious rooms with the inner ones looking over the quiet hotel courtyard. Peaceful and with very comfortable beds, this is a good value stay.

title: Must try harder
review: Stayed just one night on a flying visit to Granada.  The main advantage to this hotel is that it is about 50 metres from the Alhambra ticket office.  On pulling up in the small lay-by near the hotel I was met by a bell-boy who told me that I wasn't allowed to park there as it was for hotel guests only!    Check-in was swift and the room was very okay.  The bathroom was ridiculous - bath, separate shower, two wash basins, toilet and bidet.  As the bathroom was so large, it meant the room was a smaller than I would expect from a five star hotel.  The tea/coffee tray was in a cupboard and the light was supposed to come on when the door was opened.  The problem was that the catch that should switch the light off didn't work, so the light stayed on all night.  The problem was that…

title: Almost an excellent but has a few teething issues
review: We stayed at the Eurostars Washington Irving hotel  in a deluxe room with terrace,  room 223. We had a very enjoyable stay in the hotel. The location was perfect for us. The staff are very pleasant and helpful; the beds are very comfortable; the bathroom and in particular the shower is excellent and the breakfast is very good. The pool area is very good and the pool staff helpful and efficient. There were several minor issues which I have brought to the Managers attention and to be honest most were resolved quickly during our stay.  However I did experience an issue with my hire car. I paid the 18 euros a day for the car to be parked by the hotel but there is a procedural issue which I have informed the manager of so hopefully improvements will be made. I recommend you take a…

title: Excellent hotel!
review: This was a great stay in a chic and modern hotel. Beautifully proportioned room with lots of space and good facilities. The pool area was lovely and we were able to order an evening meal (also good) there. Bonus was the near proximity to the Alhambra Palace.

title: Perfect hotel for visiting the Alhambra
review: Loved this hotel for its high quality service, cleanliness and fabulous location just outside the Alhambra walls and a pleasant walk into Granada through the Alhambra woods. Excellent breakfast and the complimentary fruit-infused fresh water on tap at reception a lovely touch!

title: Great hotel and lovely staff!
review: We have had positive experiences at some Eurostars in Europe, but were unsure about this new Eurostars and its the location in Granada. But the big and clean room, with a very comfortable bed made up for our reservations. Much to my happiness, it was also very, very quiet for the light sleeper that I am. As for the location doubts, there are some pros and cons. The main positive aspect is that the hotel is directly in front of the Alhambra, which was perfect since we had one of the very early morning visits (highly recommend starting early - fewer tourists, weather is not so hot if going in the summer). The downside is that you away from the central area, so in the middle of summer, it's not the most convenient location to take a quick break heading up to the hotel from the…

title: magical
review: Everything about the Washington Irving was breathtaking. The service and the staff impecable, and the proximity to the Alhambra is unrivalled 😍 highly recommended. Thank u Eurostar, u surpassed all expectations

title: Perfect
review: A new hotel c3 months old which offers a very high standard of accommodation for visits to the Alhambra and Granada.  Location Opposite the main gate and at the top of a walk way to the centre of town via the Alhambra forest.  + High spec hotel Friendly staff Excellent breakfast Perfect location Superb bedrooms with a very comfy bed, mood lighting for all scenarios, unbelievable shower  -   N/a  A Perfect place to visit and stay in Granada

title: Beautiful, comfortable hotel, excellent location, loved the pool
review: I stayed here with a friend on a three day trip to Granada. We loved the Washington Irving hotel - the location cannot be beaten, as it is situated just outside the Alhambra walls and about a one minute walk to the entrance.  Despite the fact that it is so high up, it is only a 5-10 minute walk (depending on how fast you are) to Plaza Nueva down a beautiful tree-lined avenue.  The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms are really well done - lovely furnishings, big bathrooms, excellent showers, comfy beds.  We loved the pool and sauna area as well.  The only reason I am giving it 4 out of 5 stars is because the food in the restaurant is absolutely awful - I ordered a club sandwich and it came with fries that were only half-cooked.  My friend had pasta and it came without the…

title: Great location for Alhambra
review: It's a new hotel and it shows - e.g. the pool area is not yet finished, or at least it feels that way... At the same time, our room was clean and spacious, and adequately furnished - do ask for different pillows though. We thought the breakfast was very nice and service friendly. The best aspect of staying in this hotel is definitely its proximity to Alhambra - just two minutes walk to the visitor centre.

title: Good but nowhere near a 5 Star hotel
review: Stayed here for 2 nights. After check in and getting to our room and unpacking the front desk asked us to move to another room. Travelling with a baby is already difficult so we refused to move having already unpacked everything.   In a nutshell, this is a stunning looking hotel but the service is absolutely disconnected with its appearance. The food is poor and expensive compared to what you will find a few minutes walk away.  Overall I would recommend this hotel but also recommend not to have too high expectations of the staff.

title: Poor experience
review: It's definitely not the 5* hotel it claims to be, and possibly not 4*. There were no bathrobes or face flannels in the bathroom, nor did they have any when asked. The rooms are lovely in some respects, but odd in others - no drawers, for instance, and wardrobe rails so high that you can't reach the coat hangers if you're less than average height.  The restaurant has a limited and quirky (ie strangely put together) menu, though the quality and service was fine.  However, we had to send back warm white wine, and cold red wine, more than once.  My partner had  a bad experience. Finding the pool bar unstaffed one afternoon, but with no sign explaining why and no staff around, she looked in the room next to it, whereupon the door closed behind her and couldn't be opened from the…

title: Beautiful hotel
review: Fantastic rooms, beautifully crafted. Extremely well located, next to Alhambra and 5 minute walk from the crowded city area and Albaicín, with its atop mirador to Alhambra Magnific service by attendants. Very recomended!

title: Hidden Gem right next to the Alhambra
review: This lovely hotel has just been fully renovated, it looks and feels brand new.   It's a hidden gem and should be much higher up the review list of hotels for Granada.   It's just a short down hill walk from the city centre via the Alhambra gardens, although the up hill walk may put some people off.   Its location almost right next to the entrance to the Alhambra complex means that hotel overlooks the garden and is very quiet and secluded.   The restaurant offer breakfast and evening dining; useful if you want a quiet evening after a tiring day walking all over Granada.   Use the hotel coordinates on its website for your GPS device for easy access by car. Parking is by valet only using the Alhambra's carpark.   I highly recommend this hotel; all the staff we met were friendly and…

title: Great location
review: This hotel could not be closer to the Alhambra… literally across the road. From our room, we could see the outer wall of the Alhambra a mere 30 metres away. The check-in went smoothly and the room was large. The hotel was generally very nice, staff very helpful and well-priced. Hence, my 4-star rating. I would stay here again. However, on a side note, one of my pet peeves is ‘smart’ lighting where you push a button and a different lighting ‘ambiance’ is created with each button showing which ambiance it creates, be it ‘office’ or ‘welcome’ or ‘sunset’ or WHATEVER. The issue is that it is impossible to read the letters on each button so you end up pressing them all until you manage to finally switch the lights OFF. It may be great at home where you just learn which button does…

title: Perfectionism
review: I would like to thank every person in this magnificent hotel for making my stay enjoyable . I dont know from where to begin ! I think I was fortunate to be here and to achieve my father's dream visiting Alhambra . It's very near to the palace where you can go walking . Even if you'd like to visit the center it was perfect for me and for my family . They loved it so much .  Thanks to Loreto 🌷 for the constant smile , greeting and for information .

title: Beautiful hotel, bad service
review: The hotel is very nice, brand-new and fresh. However, the service was far below what you would expect from a 5* hotel. Our check-in took 45 minutes, and although our two kids were getting crazy from waiting, the staff did nothing to speed up. The parking was full when we arrived, so when I asked a girl at the reception where to park so we can at least check in, she just looked a bit stressed and suggested that we wait untill a spot becomes available..not something I would be glad to do after a 3-hour drive with two kids. The rooms don't have irons, and when I asked reception for one, they said it was being used by another guest. I called several times, but they didn't get it back, so I had to wear the same not-so-fresh dress. The next day, the iron was still not available, but…

title: Hijabi traveller- great place but with a few let downs
review: Stayed here for two nights with hubby we drove down from malaga airport, though easy to locate, there was no space to stop and take our luggage out, the few car spaces available had been taken, so i had to jump out and seek advice from the reception staff as we did not want to block off the narrow street. She advised we parked further down and then the man will come and take our car and park it offsite somewhere.. Payed 18euros for that service, Bit much if you ask us. We sat in our car with hazards on until he arrived as it was not safely out the way.. We figured parking is a real issue in granada. Anyhow moving on all checked in at 12pm midnight starving from our long journey, we wanted to order room service only to find there was such a limited menu, to what we could eat. We…

title: Perfect all around
review: Great location, great staff. The rooms are brand new and they are equipped with the latest technology. They have a great outdoor pool on the top floor, and best of all is that you are across the street from the main attraction " Alhambra "

title: New hotel with some issues
review: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights after travelling around Spain. It's located opposite the Alhambra entrance with a few restaurants nearby, we decided at the end of our travels we wanted to be out of the main city, this was perfect location if you want it to be quieter and will be visiting the Alhambra. It is a nice 15 minute walk down a wide tree lined pathway into Granada, it is quite a gradient and cobbled and uneven in parts so nice to walk down but we got a taxis back for 5 euros, we also bought a 2 day pass for the small city train the green route stops at the Alhambra. (Ladies flat shoes essential).  The hotel is new and decorated beautifully, though I did find some rooms dark with all the brown wood, we requested a brighter room and we were moved straight away. The…

title: Almost Perfect....
review: I actually changed my booking in Granada late on as I found this new hotel just opened and got a superb opening offer that I could not refuse.  Granada is not easy by car.... but as you find yourself right next to the wall of the Alhambra you feel that you are somewhere special.... and when the hotel take your car away you have arrived.  Easy and early check-in was great.... with very few guests the hotel was so quiet.  Plush decor.... dark tones.... modern and old styles mixed.... the place is just syle personified.  Our room on the 4th floor had a juliet balcony facing the Alhambra.... Magical.  The bedrooms are darkly decorated but also well illuminated.... a bath tub, twin sinks, shower toilet and bidet.... with two internal doors makes it seem special.  The air con was…

title: Excellent modern hotel near the entrance to Alhambra
review: New hotel opened recently. Everything was brand new. Great value for the price. Best location for visiting Alhambra, walk to entrance. Easy to find, easy to park. Surrounded by trees and gardens. Fabulous pool and terraces. Good breakfast in a beautiful restaurant. Designer furnishings. Quotes from Shakespear and Washington Iving inscribed on the walls. The best hotel in Granada.

title: Our best stay in Spain
review: This was definitely the best hotel we stayed in during our roadtrip in Spain and actually the only one which was able to offer appropriate sevices to the price you pay and really deserves five stars. The staff was helpful, location of the hotel is just fantastic (and Granada is so romantic), the rooms are lovely equipped and the breakfast is delicious. When you are tired after all day of discovering all the city, the swimming pool on the roof is a great choice.

title: Fantastic hotel in front of the historic Alhambra
review: Fantastic hotel Amazingly well equipped and decorated rooms Great & very friendly staff Superb scenery and setting Easy walk to center Big Breakfast buffet Very clean  Price/quality one of the best ever visited Highly recommended for Geanada trip

title: Brand new and excellent
review: The hotel is a refurbished place directly opposite the Alhambra. The rooms are about 20sqm with most overlooking the leafy street. Air conditioning is the quietest I've ever experienced. Bed and sheeting was top quality. Bathroom had a separate bath and shower with great power.  To walk down to the town is an easy walk on the wood track past the Alhambra.  Or walk straight down the road to the Hotel Palace Alhambra then turn right down the cobble stone path. It's 700m straight down but the quickest way down. It's also to the closest supermarket 'courivan'.

title: Great find!
review: Booked this hotel last minute for only $89 a night! Perfect location for la Alhambra! Only a 4 minute walk to the entrance. About a 12-15 minute walk into the center of town, but a beautiful path through a wooded area. A little bit harder to walk back from the center since it's up hill, but worth the walk. Service at the hotel was amazing, the bar at the pool wasn't opened yet, but we ordered in the lobby and they brought it up for us once we had changed for the pool. The pool was a perfect temperature and a beautiful area to lay out. Rooms were quiet and very tranquil. They parked our car for us in the Alhambra parking area and at a discount. We actually had an Airbnb for our second night in Granada but decided to forgo it because we loved the Washington Irving so much.

title: Outstanding
review: Stayed for 2 nights, from 11-13 June. Far exceeded expectations. The service of hotel personnel was outstanding, the room very cozy and ample...excellent location very close to Alhambra and walking distance to centre of town. Highly recommend the hotel

title: A nice surprise
review: I booked this hotel just one day before travel and was a little bit nervous as there were not yet any reviews or photographs of any of the communal areas! Normally I am one to scope out the best hotel for weeks, so this was a leap of faith for me!  We were though very pleasantly surprised! The hotel is literally brand spanking new, has been open just one week in fact! It was a great location with spacious and comfortable modern rooms. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.   The pool and gym I don't think we're yet ready for use. The gym didn't have any equipment and it was more like a sauna than a gym (roasting!), I think it will go on to be a very popular hotel, we'd definitely go back!
